2875 }
2876 
2877 /*
2878  * Get current mouse coordinates in text window.
2879  */
2880  void
2881 gui_mch_getmouse(int *x, int *y)
2882 {
2883  RECT rct;
2884  POINT mp;
2885 
2886  (void)GetWindowRect(s_textArea, &rct);
2887  (void)GetCursorPos((LPPOINT)&mp);
2888  *x = (int)(mp.x - rct.left);
2889  *y = (int)(mp.y - rct.top);
2890 }
2891 
2892 /*
2893  * Move mouse pointer to character at (x, y).
2894  */
2895  void
2896 gui_mch_setmouse(int x, int y)
2897 {
2898  RECT rct;
2899 
2900  (void)GetWindowRect(s_textArea, &rct);
2901  (void)SetCursorPos(x + gui.border_offset + rct.left,
2902  y + gui.border_offset + rct.top);
2903 }
2904 
2905  static void
2906 gui_mswin_get_valid_dimensions(
2907  int w,
2908  int h,
2909  int *valid_w,
2910  int *valid_h)
2911 {
2912  int base_width, base_height;
2913 
2914  base_width = gui_get_base_width()
2915  + (GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXFRAME) +
2916  GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXPADDEDBORDER)) * 2;
2917  base_height = gui_get_base_height()
2918  + (GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYFRAME) +
2919  GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXPADDEDBORDER)) * 2
2920  + GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYCAPTION)
2921 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
2922  + gui_mswin_get_menu_height(FALSE)
2923 #endif
2924  ;
2925  *valid_w = base_width +
2926  ((w - base_width) / gui.char_width) * gui.char_width;
2927  *valid_h = base_height +
2928  ((h - base_height) / gui.char_height) * gui.char_height;
2929 }
2930 
2931  void
2932 gui_mch_flash(int msec)
2933 {
2934  RECT rc;
2935 
2936 #if defined(FEAT_DIRECTX)
2937  if (IS_ENABLE_DIRECTX())
2938  DWriteContext_Flush(s_dwc);
2939 #endif
2940 
2941  /*
2942  * Note: InvertRect() excludes right and bottom of rectangle.
2943  */
2944  rc.left = 0;
2945  rc.top = 0;
2946  rc.right = gui.num_cols * gui.char_width;
2947  rc.bottom = gui.num_rows * gui.char_height;
2948  InvertRect(s_hdc, &rc);
2949  gui_mch_flush(); /* make sure it's displayed */
2950 
2951  ui_delay((long)msec, TRUE); /* wait for a few msec */
2952 
2953  InvertRect(s_hdc, &rc);
2954 }
2955 
2956 /*
2957  * Return flags used for scrolling.
2958  * The SW_INVALIDATE is required when part of the window is covered or
2959  * off-screen. Refer to MS KB Q75236.
2960  */
2961  static int
2962 get_scroll_flags(void)
2963 {
2964  HWND hwnd;
2965  RECT rcVim, rcOther, rcDest;
2966 
2967  GetWindowRect(s_hwnd, &rcVim);
2968 
2969  /* Check if the window is partly above or below the screen. We don't care
2970  * about partly left or right of the screen, it is not relevant when
2971  * scrolling up or down. */
2972  if (rcVim.top < 0 || rcVim.bottom > GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYFULLSCREEN))
2973  return SW_INVALIDATE;
2974 
2975  /* Check if there is an window (partly) on top of us. */
2976  for (hwnd = s_hwnd; (hwnd = GetWindow(hwnd, GW_HWNDPREV)) != (HWND)0; )
2977  if (IsWindowVisible(hwnd))
2978  {
2979  GetWindowRect(hwnd, &rcOther);
2980  if (IntersectRect(&rcDest, &rcVim, &rcOther))
2981  return SW_INVALIDATE;
2982  }
2983  return 0;
2984 }
2985 
2986 /*
2987  * On some Intel GPUs, the regions drawn just prior to ScrollWindowEx()
2988  * may not be scrolled out properly.
2989  * For gVim, when _OnScroll() is repeated, the character at the
2990  * previous cursor position may be left drawn after scroll.
2991  * The problem can be avoided by calling GetPixel() to get a pixel in
2992  * the region before ScrollWindowEx().
2993  */
2994  static void
2995 intel_gpu_workaround(void)
2996 {
2997  GetPixel(s_hdc, FILL_X(gui.col), FILL_Y(gui.row));
2998 }
2999 
3000 /*
3001  * Delete the given number of lines from the given row, scrolling up any
3002  * text further down within the scroll region.
3003  */
3004  void
3005 gui_mch_delete_lines(
3006  int row,
3007  int num_lines)
3008 {
3009  RECT rc;
3010 
3011  rc.left = FILL_X(gui.scroll_region_left);
3012  rc.right = FILL_X(gui.scroll_region_right + 1);
3013  rc.top = FILL_Y(row);
3014  rc.bottom = FILL_Y(gui.scroll_region_bot + 1);
3015 
3016 #if defined(FEAT_DIRECTX)
3017  if (IS_ENABLE_DIRECTX())
3018  {
3019  DWriteContext_Scroll(s_dwc, 0, -num_lines * gui.char_height, &rc);
3020  DWriteContext_Flush(s_dwc);
3021  }
3022  else
3023 #endif
3024  {
3025  intel_gpu_workaround();
3026  ScrollWindowEx(s_textArea, 0, -num_lines * gui.char_height,
3027  &rc, &rc, NULL, NULL, get_scroll_flags());
3028  UpdateWindow(s_textArea);
3029  }
3030 
3031  /* This seems to be required to avoid the cursor disappearing when
3032  * scrolling such that the cursor ends up in the top-left character on
3033  * the screen... But why? (Webb) */
3034  /* It's probably fixed by disabling drawing the cursor while scrolling. */
3035  /* gui.cursor_is_valid = FALSE; */
3036 
3037  gui_clear_block(gui.scroll_region_bot - num_lines + 1,
3038  gui.scroll_region_left,
3039  gui.scroll_region_bot, gui.scroll_region_right);
3040 }
3041 
3042 /*
3043  * Insert the given number of lines before the given row, scrolling down any
3044  * following text within the scroll region.
3045  */
3046  void
3047 gui_mch_insert_lines(
3048  int row,
3049  int num_lines)
3050 {
3051  RECT rc;
3052 
3053  rc.left = FILL_X(gui.scroll_region_left);
3054  rc.right = FILL_X(gui.scroll_region_right + 1);
3055  rc.top = FILL_Y(row);
3056  rc.bottom = FILL_Y(gui.scroll_region_bot + 1);
3057 
3058 #if defined(FEAT_DIRECTX)
3059  if (IS_ENABLE_DIRECTX())
3060  {
3061  DWriteContext_Scroll(s_dwc, 0, num_lines * gui.char_height, &rc);
3062  DWriteContext_Flush(s_dwc);
3063  }
3064  else
3065 #endif
3066  {
3067  intel_gpu_workaround();
3068  /* The SW_INVALIDATE is required when part of the window is covered or
3069  * off-screen. How do we avoid it when it's not needed? */
3070  ScrollWindowEx(s_textArea, 0, num_lines * gui.char_height,
3071  &rc, &rc, NULL, NULL, get_scroll_flags());
3072  UpdateWindow(s_textArea);
3073  }
3074 
3075  gui_clear_block(row, gui.scroll_region_left,
3076  row + num_lines - 1, gui.scroll_region_right);
3077 }
3078 
3079 
3080  void
3081 gui_mch_exit(int rc UNUSED)
3082 {
3083 #if defined(FEAT_DIRECTX)
3084  DWriteContext_Close(s_dwc);
3085  DWrite_Final();
3086  s_dwc = NULL;
3087 #endif
3088 
3089  ReleaseDC(s_textArea, s_hdc);
3090  DeleteObject(s_brush);
3091 
3092 #ifdef FEAT_TEAROFF
3093  /* Unload the tearoff bitmap */
3094  (void)DeleteObject((HGDIOBJ)s_htearbitmap);
3095 #endif
3096 
3097  /* Destroy our window (if we have one). */
3098  if (s_hwnd != NULL)
3099  {
3100  destroying = TRUE; /* ignore WM_DESTROY message now */
3101  DestroyWindow(s_hwnd);
3102  }
3103 
3104 #ifdef GLOBAL_IME
3105  global_ime_end();
3106 #endif
3107 }
3108 
3109  static char_u *
3110 logfont2name(LOGFONTW lf)
3111 {
3112  char *p;
3113  char *res;
3114  char *charset_name;
3115  char *quality_name;
3116  char *font_name;
3117  int points;
3118 
3119  font_name = (char *)utf16_to_enc(lf.lfFaceName, NULL);
3120  if (font_name == NULL)
3121  return NULL;
3122  charset_name = charset_id2name((int)lf.lfCharSet);
3123  quality_name = quality_id2name((int)lf.lfQuality);
3124 
3125  res = alloc(strlen(font_name) + 30
3126  + (charset_name == NULL ? 0 : strlen(charset_name) + 2)
3127  + (quality_name == NULL ? 0 : strlen(quality_name) + 2));
3128  if (res != NULL)
3129  {
3130  p = res;
3131  // make a normal font string out of the lf thing:
3132  points = pixels_to_points(
3133  lf.lfHeight < 0 ? -lf.lfHeight : lf.lfHeight, TRUE);
3134  if (lf.lfWeight == FW_NORMAL || lf.lfWeight == FW_BOLD)
3135  sprintf((char *)p, "%s:h%d", font_name, points);
3136  else
3137  sprintf((char *)p, "%s:h%d:W%ld", font_name, points, lf.lfWeight);
3138  while (*p)
3139  {
3140  if (*p == ' ')
3141  *p = '_';
3142  ++p;
3143  }
3144  if (lf.lfItalic)
3145  STRCAT(p, ":i");
3146  if (lf.lfWeight == FW_BOLD)
3147  STRCAT(p, ":b");
3148  if (lf.lfUnderline)
3149  STRCAT(p, ":u");
3150  if (lf.lfStrikeOut)
3151  STRCAT(p, ":s");
3152  if (charset_name != NULL)
3153  {
3154  STRCAT(p, ":c");
3155  STRCAT(p, charset_name);
3156  }
3157  if (quality_name != NULL)
3158  {
3159  STRCAT(p, ":q");
3160  STRCAT(p, quality_name);
3161  }
3162  }
3163 
3164  vim_free(font_name);
3165  return (char_u *)res;
3166 }
3167 
3168 
3169 #ifdef FEAT_MBYTE_IME
3170 /*
3171  * Set correct LOGFONTW to IME. Use 'guifontwide' if available, otherwise use
3172  * 'guifont'
3173  */
3174  static void
3175 update_im_font(void)
3176 {
3177  LOGFONTW lf_wide;
3178 
3179  if (p_guifontwide != NULL && *p_guifontwide != NUL
3180  && gui.wide_font != NOFONT
3181  && GetObjectW((HFONT)gui.wide_font, sizeof(lf_wide), &lf_wide))
3182  norm_logfont = lf_wide;
3183  else
3184  norm_logfont = sub_logfont;
3185  im_set_font(&norm_logfont);
3186 }
3187 #endif
3188 
3189 /*
3190  * Handler of gui.wide_font (p_guifontwide) changed notification.
3191  */
3192  void
3193 gui_mch_wide_font_changed(void)
3194 {
3195  LOGFONTW lf;
3196 
3197 #ifdef FEAT_MBYTE_IME
3198  update_im_font();
3199 #endif
3200 
3201  gui_mch_free_font(gui.wide_ital_font);
3202  gui.wide_ital_font = NOFONT;
3203  gui_mch_free_font(gui.wide_bold_font);
3204  gui.wide_bold_font = NOFONT;
3205  gui_mch_free_font(gui.wide_boldital_font);
3206  gui.wide_boldital_font = NOFONT;
3207 
3208  if (gui.wide_font
3209  && GetObjectW((HFONT)gui.wide_font, sizeof(lf), &lf))
3210  {
3211  if (!lf.lfItalic)
3212  {
3213  lf.lfItalic = TRUE;
3214  gui.wide_ital_font = get_font_handle(&lf);
3215  lf.lfItalic = FALSE;
3216  }
3217  if (lf.lfWeight < FW_BOLD)
3218  {
3219  lf.lfWeight = FW_BOLD;
3220  gui.wide_bold_font = get_font_handle(&lf);
3221  if (!lf.lfItalic)
3222  {
3223  lf.lfItalic = TRUE;
3224  gui.wide_boldital_font = get_font_handle(&lf);
3225  }
3226  }
3227  }
3228 }
3229 
3230 /*
3231  * Initialise vim to use the font with the given name.
3232  * Return FAIL if the font could not be loaded, OK otherwise.
3233  */
3234  int
3235 gui_mch_init_font(char_u *font_name, int fontset UNUSED)
3236 {
3237  LOGFONTW lf;
3238  GuiFont font = NOFONT;
3239  char_u *p;
3240 
3241  /* Load the font */
3242  if (get_logfont(&lf, font_name, NULL, TRUE) == OK)
3243  font = get_font_handle(&lf);
3244  if (font == NOFONT)
3245  return FAIL;
3246 
3247  if (font_name == NULL)
3248  font_name = (char_u *)lf.lfFaceName;
3249 #if defined(FEAT_MBYTE_IME) || defined(GLOBAL_IME)
3250  norm_logfont = lf;
3251 #endif
3252 #ifdef FEAT_MBYTE_IME
3253  sub_logfont = lf;
3254 #endif
3255 #ifdef FEAT_MBYTE_IME
3256  update_im_font();
3257 #endif
3258  gui_mch_free_font(gui.norm_font);
3259  gui.norm_font = font;
3260  current_font_height = lf.lfHeight;
3261  GetFontSize(font);
3262 
3263  p = logfont2name(lf);
3264  if (p != NULL)
3265  {
3266  hl_set_font_name(p);
3267 
3268  /* When setting 'guifont' to "*" replace it with the actual font name.
3269  * */
3270  if (STRCMP(font_name, "*") == 0 && STRCMP(p_guifont, "*") == 0)
3271  {
3272  vim_free(p_guifont);
3273  p_guifont = p;
3274  }
3275  else
3276  vim_free(p);
3277  }
3278 
3279  gui_mch_free_font(gui.ital_font);
3280  gui.ital_font = NOFONT;
3281  gui_mch_free_font(gui.bold_font);
3282  gui.bold_font = NOFONT;
3283  gui_mch_free_font(gui.boldital_font);
3284  gui.boldital_font = NOFONT;
3285 
3286  if (!lf.lfItalic)
3287  {
3288  lf.lfItalic = TRUE;
3289  gui.ital_font = get_font_handle(&lf);
3290  lf.lfItalic = FALSE;
3291  }
3292  if (lf.lfWeight < FW_BOLD)
3293  {
3294  lf.lfWeight = FW_BOLD;
3295  gui.bold_font = get_font_handle(&lf);
3296  if (!lf.lfItalic)
3297  {
3298  lf.lfItalic = TRUE;
3299  gui.boldital_font = get_font_handle(&lf);
3300  }
3301  }
3302 
3303  return OK;
3304 }
3305 
3306 #ifndef WPF_RESTORETOMAXIMIZED
3307 # define WPF_RESTORETOMAXIMIZED 2 /* just in case someone doesn't have it */
3308 #endif
3309 
3310 /*
3311  * Return TRUE if the GUI window is maximized, filling the whole screen.
3312  */
3313  int
3314 gui_mch_maximized(void)
3315 {
3316  WINDOWPLACEMENT wp;
3317 
3318  wp.length = sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT);
3319  if (GetWindowPlacement(s_hwnd, &wp))
3320  return wp.showCmd == SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
3321  || (wp.showCmd == SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
3322  && wp.flags == WPF_RESTORETOMAXIMIZED);
3323 
3324  return 0;
3325 }
3326 
3327 /*
3328  * Called when the font changed while the window is maximized or GO_KEEPWINSIZE
3329  * is set. Compute the new Rows and Columns. This is like resizing the
3330  * window.
3331  */
3332  void
3333 gui_mch_newfont(void)
3334 {
3335  RECT rect;
3336 
3337  GetWindowRect(s_hwnd, &rect);
3338  if (win_socket_id == 0)
3339  {
3340  gui_resize_shell(rect.right - rect.left
3341  - (GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXFRAME) +
3342  GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXPADDEDBORDER)) * 2,
3343  rect.bottom - rect.top
3344  - (GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYFRAME) +
3345  GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXPADDEDBORDER)) * 2
3346  - GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYCAPTION)
3347 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
3348  - gui_mswin_get_menu_height(FALSE)
3349 #endif
3350  );
3351  }
3352  else
3353  {
3354  /* Inside another window, don't use the frame and border. */
3355  gui_resize_shell(rect.right - rect.left,
3356  rect.bottom - rect.top
3357 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
3358  - gui_mswin_get_menu_height(FALSE)
3359 #endif
3360  );
3361  }
3362 }
3363 
3364 /*
3365  * Set the window title
3366  */
3367  void
3368 gui_mch_settitle(
3369  char_u *title,
3370  char_u *icon UNUSED)
3371 {
3372  set_window_title(s_hwnd, (title == NULL ? "VIM" : (char *)title));
3373 }
3374 
3375 #if defined(FEAT_MOUSESHAPE) || defined(PROTO)
3376 /* Table for shape IDCs. Keep in sync with the mshape_names[] table in
3377  * misc2.c! */
3378 static LPCSTR mshape_idcs[] =
3379 {
3380  IDC_ARROW, /* arrow */
3381  MAKEINTRESOURCE(0), /* blank */
3382  IDC_IBEAM, /* beam */
3383  IDC_SIZENS, /* updown */
3384  IDC_SIZENS, /* udsizing */
3385  IDC_SIZEWE, /* leftright */
3386  IDC_SIZEWE, /* lrsizing */
3387  IDC_WAIT, /* busy */
3388  IDC_NO, /* no */
3389  IDC_ARROW, /* crosshair */
3390  IDC_ARROW, /* hand1 */
3391  IDC_ARROW, /* hand2 */
3392  IDC_ARROW, /* pencil */
3393  IDC_ARROW, /* question */
3394  IDC_ARROW, /* right-arrow */
3395  IDC_UPARROW, /* up-arrow */
3396  IDC_ARROW /* last one */
3397 };
3398 
3399  void
3400 mch_set_mouse_shape(int shape)
3401 {
3402  LPCSTR idc;
3403 
3404  if (shape == MSHAPE_HIDE)
3405  ShowCursor(FALSE);
3406  else
3407  {
3408  if (shape >= MSHAPE_NUMBERED)
3409  idc = IDC_ARROW;
3410  else
3411  idc = mshape_idcs[shape];
3412 #ifdef SetClassLongPtr
3413  SetClassLongPtr(s_textArea, GCLP_HCURSOR, (__int3264)(LONG_PTR)LoadCursor(NULL, idc));
3414 #else
3415  SetClassLong(s_textArea, GCL_HCURSOR, (long_u)LoadCursor(NULL, idc));
3416 #endif
3417  if (!p_mh)
3418  {
3419  POINT mp;
3420 
3421  /* Set the position to make it redrawn with the new shape. */
3422  (void)GetCursorPos((LPPOINT)&mp);
3423  (void)SetCursorPos(mp.x, mp.y);
3424  ShowCursor(TRUE);
3425  }
3426  }
3427 }
3428 #endif
3429 
3430 #if defined(FEAT_BROWSE) || defined(PROTO)
3431 /*
3432  * Wide version of convert_filter().
3433  */
3434  static WCHAR *
3435 convert_filterW(char_u *s)
3436 {
3437  char_u *tmp;
3438  int len;
3439  WCHAR *res;
3440 
3441  tmp = convert_filter(s);
3442  if (tmp == NULL)
3443  return NULL;
3444  len = (int)STRLEN(s) + 3;
3445  res = enc_to_utf16(tmp, &len);
3446  vim_free(tmp);
3447  return res;
3448 }
3449 
3450 /*
3451  * Pop open a file browser and return the file selected, in allocated memory,
3452  * or NULL if Cancel is hit.
3453  * saving - TRUE if the file will be saved to, FALSE if it will be opened.
3454  * title - Title message for the file browser dialog.
3455  * dflt - Default name of file.
3456  * ext - Default extension to be added to files without extensions.
3457  * initdir - directory in which to open the browser (NULL = current dir)
3458  * filter - Filter for matched files to choose from.
3459  */
3460  char_u *
3461 gui_mch_browse(
3462  int saving,
3463  char_u *title,
3464  char_u *dflt,
3465  char_u *ext,
3466  char_u *initdir,
3467  char_u *filter)
3468 {
3469  /* We always use the wide function. This means enc_to_utf16() must work,
3470  * otherwise it fails miserably! */
3471  OPENFILENAMEW fileStruct;
3472  WCHAR fileBuf[MAXPATHL];
3473  WCHAR *wp;
3474  int i;
3475  WCHAR *titlep = NULL;
3476  WCHAR *extp = NULL;
3477  WCHAR *initdirp = NULL;
3478  WCHAR *filterp;
3479  char_u *p, *q;
3480 
3481  if (dflt == NULL)
3482  fileBuf[0] = NUL;
3483  else
3484  {
3485  wp = enc_to_utf16(dflt, NULL);
3486  if (wp == NULL)
3487  fileBuf[0] = NUL;
3488  else
3489  {
3490  for (i = 0; wp[i] != NUL && i < MAXPATHL - 1; ++i)
3491  fileBuf[i] = wp[i];
3492  fileBuf[i] = NUL;
3493  vim_free(wp);
3494  }
3495  }
3496 
3497  /* Convert the filter to Windows format. */
3498  filterp = convert_filterW(filter);
3499 
3500  vim_memset(&fileStruct, 0, sizeof(OPENFILENAMEW));
3501 # ifdef OPENFILENAME_SIZE_VERSION_400W
3502  /* be compatible with Windows NT 4.0 */
3503  fileStruct.lStructSize = OPENFILENAME_SIZE_VERSION_400W;
3504 # else
3505  fileStruct.lStructSize = sizeof(fileStruct);
3506 # endif
3507 
3508  if (title != NULL)
3509  titlep = enc_to_utf16(title, NULL);
3510  fileStruct.lpstrTitle = titlep;
3511 
3512  if (ext != NULL)
3513  extp = enc_to_utf16(ext, NULL);
3514  fileStruct.lpstrDefExt = extp;
3515 
3516  fileStruct.lpstrFile = fileBuf;
3517  fileStruct.nMaxFile = MAXPATHL;
3518  fileStruct.lpstrFilter = filterp;
3519  fileStruct.hwndOwner = s_hwnd; /* main Vim window is owner*/
3520  /* has an initial dir been specified? */
3521  if (initdir != NULL && *initdir != NUL)
3522  {
3523  /* Must have backslashes here, no matter what 'shellslash' says */
3524  initdirp = enc_to_utf16(initdir, NULL);
3525  if (initdirp != NULL)
3526  {
3527  for (wp = initdirp; *wp != NUL; ++wp)
3528  if (*wp == '/')
3529  *wp = '\\';
3530  }
3531  fileStruct.lpstrInitialDir = initdirp;
3532  }
3533 
3534  /*
3535  * TODO: Allow selection of multiple files. Needs another arg to this
3536  * function to ask for it, and need to use OFN_ALLOWMULTISELECT below.
3537  * Also, should we use OFN_FILEMUSTEXIST when opening? Vim can edit on
3538  * files that don't exist yet, so I haven't put it in. What about
3539  * OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST?
3540  * Don't use OFN_OVERWRITEPROMPT, Vim has its own ":confirm" dialog.
3541  */
3542  fileStruct.Flags = (OFN_NOCHANGEDIR | OFN_PATHMUSTEXIST | OFN_HIDEREADONLY);
3543 # ifdef FEAT_SHORTCUT
3544  if (curbuf->b_p_bin)
3545  fileStruct.Flags |= OFN_NODEREFERENCELINKS;
3546 # endif
3547  if (saving)
3548  {
3549  if (!GetSaveFileNameW(&fileStruct))
3550  return NULL;
3551  }
3552  else
3553  {
3554  if (!GetOpenFileNameW(&fileStruct))
3555  return NULL;
3556  }
3557 
3558  vim_free(filterp);
3559  vim_free(initdirp);
3560  vim_free(titlep);
3561  vim_free(extp);
3562 
3563  /* Convert from UCS2 to 'encoding'. */
3564  p = utf16_to_enc(fileBuf, NULL);
3565  if (p == NULL)
3566  return NULL;
3567 
3568  /* Give focus back to main window (when using MDI). */
3569  SetFocus(s_hwnd);
3570 
3571  /* Shorten the file name if possible */
3572  q = vim_strsave(shorten_fname1(p));
3573  vim_free(p);
3574  return q;
3575 }
3576 
3577 
3578 /*
3579  * Convert the string s to the proper format for a filter string by replacing
3580  * the \t and \n delimiters with \0.
3581  * Returns the converted string in allocated memory.
3582  *
3583  * Keep in sync with convert_filterW() above!
3584  */
3585  static char_u *
3586 convert_filter(char_u *s)
3587 {
3588  char_u *res;
3589  unsigned s_len = (unsigned)STRLEN(s);
3590  unsigned i;
3591 
3592  res = alloc(s_len + 3);
3593  if (res != NULL)
3594  {
3595  for (i = 0; i < s_len; ++i)
3596  if (s[i] == '\t' || s[i] == '\n')
3597  res[i] = '\0';
3598  else
3599  res[i] = s[i];
3600  res[s_len] = NUL;
3601  /* Add two extra NULs to make sure it's properly terminated. */
3602  res[s_len + 1] = NUL;
3603  res[s_len + 2] = NUL;
3604  }
3605  return res;
3606 }
3607 
3608 /*
3609  * Select a directory.
3610  */
3611  char_u *
3612 gui_mch_browsedir(char_u *title, char_u *initdir)
3613 {
3614  /* We fake this: Use a filter that doesn't select anything and a default
3615  * file name that won't be used. */
3616  return gui_mch_browse(0, title, (char_u *)_("Not Used"), NULL,
3617  initdir, (char_u *)_("Directory\t*.nothing\n"));
3618 }
3619 #endif /* FEAT_BROWSE */
3620 
3621  static void
3622 _OnDropFiles(
3623  HWND hwnd UNUSED,
3624  HDROP hDrop)
3625 {
3626 #define BUFPATHLEN _MAX_PATH
3627 #define DRAGQVAL 0xFFFFFFFF
3628  WCHAR wszFile[BUFPATHLEN];
3629  char szFile[BUFPATHLEN];
3630  UINT cFiles = DragQueryFile(hDrop, DRAGQVAL, NULL, 0);
3631  UINT i;
3632  char_u **fnames;
3633  POINT pt;
3634  int_u modifiers = 0;
3635 
3636  /* TRACE("_OnDropFiles: %d files dropped\n", cFiles); */
3637 
3638  /* Obtain dropped position */
3639  DragQueryPoint(hDrop, &pt);
3640  MapWindowPoints(s_hwnd, s_textArea, &pt, 1);
3641 
3642  reset_VIsual();
3643 
3644  fnames = ALLOC_MULT(char_u *, cFiles);
3645 
3646  if (fnames != NULL)
3647  for (i = 0; i < cFiles; ++i)
3648  {
3649  if (DragQueryFileW(hDrop, i, wszFile, BUFPATHLEN) > 0)
3650  fnames[i] = utf16_to_enc(wszFile, NULL);
3651  else
3652  {
3653  DragQueryFile(hDrop, i, szFile, BUFPATHLEN);
3654  fnames[i] = vim_strsave((char_u *)szFile);
3655  }
3656  }
3657 
3658  DragFinish(hDrop);
3659 
3660  if (fnames != NULL)
3661  {
3662  if ((GetKeyState(VK_SHIFT) & 0x8000) != 0)
3663  modifiers |= MOUSE_SHIFT;
3664  if ((GetKeyState(VK_CONTROL) & 0x8000) != 0)
3665  modifiers |= MOUSE_CTRL;
3666  if ((GetKeyState(VK_MENU) & 0x8000) != 0)
3667  modifiers |= MOUSE_ALT;
3668 
3669  gui_handle_drop(pt.x, pt.y, modifiers, fnames, cFiles);
3670 
3671  s_need_activate = TRUE;
3672  }
3673 }
3674 
3675  static int
3676 _OnScroll(
3677  HWND hwnd UNUSED,
3678  HWND hwndCtl,
3679  UINT code,
3680  int pos)
3681 {
3682  static UINT prev_code = 0; /* code of previous call */
3683  scrollbar_T *sb, *sb_info;
3684  long val;
3685  int dragging = FALSE;
3686  int dont_scroll_save = dont_scroll;
3687  SCROLLINFO si;
3688 
3689  si.cbSize = sizeof(si);
3690  si.fMask = SIF_POS;
3691 
3692  sb = gui_mswin_find_scrollbar(hwndCtl);
3693  if (sb == NULL)
3694  return 0;
3695 
3696  if (sb->wp != NULL) /* Left or right scrollbar */
3697  {
3698  /*
3699  * Careful: need to get scrollbar info out of first (left) scrollbar
3700  * for window, but keep real scrollbar too because we must pass it to
3701  * gui_drag_scrollbar().
3702  */
3703  sb_info = &sb->wp->w_scrollbars[0];
3704  }
3705  else /* Bottom scrollbar */
3706  sb_info = sb;
3707  val = sb_info->value;
3708 
3709  switch (code)
3710  {
3711  case SB_THUMBTRACK:
3712  val = pos;
3713  dragging = TRUE;
3714  if (sb->scroll_shift > 0)
3715  val <<= sb->scroll_shift;
3716  break;
3717  case SB_LINEDOWN:
3718  val++;
3719  break;
3720  case SB_LINEUP:
3721  val--;
3722  break;
3723  case SB_PAGEDOWN:
3724  val += (sb_info->size > 2 ? sb_info->size - 2 : 1);
3725  break;
3726  case SB_PAGEUP:
3727  val -= (sb_info->size > 2 ? sb_info->size - 2 : 1);
3728  break;
3729  case SB_TOP:
3730  val = 0;
3731  break;
3732  case SB_BOTTOM:
3733  val = sb_info->max;
3734  break;
3735  case SB_ENDSCROLL:
3736  if (prev_code == SB_THUMBTRACK)
3737  {
3738  /*
3739  * "pos" only gives us 16-bit data. In case of large file,
3740  * use GetScrollPos() which returns 32-bit. Unfortunately it
3741  * is not valid while the scrollbar is being dragged.
3742  */
3743  val = GetScrollPos(hwndCtl, SB_CTL);
3744  if (sb->scroll_shift > 0)
3745  val <<= sb->scroll_shift;
3746  }
3747  break;
3748 
3749  default:
3750  /* TRACE("Unknown scrollbar event %d\n", code); */
3751  return 0;
3752  }
3753  prev_code = code;
3754 
3755  si.nPos = (sb->scroll_shift > 0) ? val >> sb->scroll_shift : val;
3756  SetScrollInfo(hwndCtl, SB_CTL, &si, TRUE);
3757 
3758  /*
3759  * When moving a vertical scrollbar, move the other vertical scrollbar too.
3760  */
3761  if (sb->wp != NULL)
3762  {
3763  scrollbar_T *sba = sb->wp->w_scrollbars;
3764  HWND id = sba[ (sb == sba + SBAR_LEFT) ? SBAR_RIGHT : SBAR_LEFT].id;
3765 
3766  SetScrollInfo(id, SB_CTL, &si, TRUE);
3767  }
3768 
3769  /* Don't let us be interrupted here by another message. */
3770  s_busy_processing = TRUE;
3771 
3772  /* When "allow_scrollbar" is FALSE still need to remember the new
3773  * position, but don't actually scroll by setting "dont_scroll". */
3774  dont_scroll = !allow_scrollbar;
3775 
3776  mch_disable_flush();
3777  gui_drag_scrollbar(sb, val, dragging);
3778  mch_enable_flush();
3779  gui_may_flush();
3780 
3781  s_busy_processing = FALSE;
3782  dont_scroll = dont_scroll_save;
3783 
3784  return 0;
3785 }
3786 
3787 
3788 #ifdef FEAT_XPM_W32
3789 # include "xpm_w32.h"
3790 #endif
3791 
3792 #ifdef PROTO
3793 # define WINAPI
3794 #endif
3795 
3796 #ifdef __MINGW32__
3797 /*
3798  * Add a lot of missing defines.
3799  * They are not always missing, we need the #ifndef's.
3800  */
3801 # ifndef IsMinimized
3802 # define IsMinimized(hwnd) IsIconic(hwnd)
3803 # endif
3804 # ifndef IsMaximized
3805 # define IsMaximized(hwnd) IsZoomed(hwnd)
3806 # endif
3807 # ifndef SelectFont
3808 # define SelectFont(hdc, hfont) ((HFONT)SelectObject((hdc), (HGDIOBJ)(HFONT)(hfont)))
3809 # endif
3810 # ifndef GetStockBrush
3811 # define GetStockBrush(i) ((HBRUSH)GetStockObject(i))
3812 # endif
3813 # ifndef DeleteBrush
3814 # define DeleteBrush(hbr) DeleteObject((HGDIOBJ)(HBRUSH)(hbr))
3815 # endif
3816 
3817 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK
3818 # define HANDLE_WM_RBUTTONDBLCLK(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3819  ((fn)((hwnd), TRUE, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3820 # endif
3821 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_MBUTTONUP
3822 # define HANDLE_WM_MBUTTONUP(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3823  ((fn)((hwnd), (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3824 # endif
3825 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK
3826 # define HANDLE_WM_MBUTTONDBLCLK(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3827  ((fn)((hwnd), TRUE, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3828 # endif
3829 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK
3830 # define HANDLE_WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3831  ((fn)((hwnd), TRUE, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3832 # endif
3833 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_RBUTTONDOWN
3834 # define HANDLE_WM_RBUTTONDOWN(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3835  ((fn)((hwnd), FALSE, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3836 # endif
3837 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_MOUSEMOVE
3838 # define HANDLE_WM_MOUSEMOVE(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3839  ((fn)((hwnd), (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3840 # endif

3843  ((fn)((hwnd), (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3844 # endif
3845 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_MBUTTONDOWN
3846 # define HANDLE_WM_MBUTTONDOWN(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3847  ((fn)((hwnd), FALSE, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3848 # endif
3849 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_LBUTTONUP
3850 # define HANDLE_WM_LBUTTONUP(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3851  ((fn)((hwnd), (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3852 # endif
3853 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_LBUTTONDOWN
3854 # define HANDLE_WM_LBUTTONDOWN(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3855  ((fn)((hwnd), FALSE, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam), (int)(short)HIWORD(lParam), (UINT)(wParam)), 0L)
3856 # endif
3857 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_SYSCHAR
3858 # define HANDLE_WM_SYSCHAR(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3859  ((fn)((hwnd), (TCHAR)(wParam), (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam)), 0L)
3860 # endif
3861 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_ACTIVATEAPP
3862 # define HANDLE_WM_ACTIVATEAPP(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3863  ((fn)((hwnd), (BOOL)(wParam), (DWORD)(lParam)), 0L)
3864 # endif
3865 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING
3866 # define HANDLE_WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3867  (LRESULT)(DWORD)(BOOL)(fn)((hwnd), (LPWINDOWPOS)(lParam))
3868 # endif
3869 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_VSCROLL
3870 # define HANDLE_WM_VSCROLL(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3871  ((fn)((hwnd), (HWND)(lParam), (UINT)(LOWORD(wParam)), (int)(short)HIWORD(wParam)), 0L)
3872 # endif
3873 # ifndef HANDLE_WM_SETFOCUS
3874 # define HANDLE_WM_SETFOCUS(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3875  ((fn)((hwnd), (HWND)(wParam)), 0L)
3876 # endif

3878 # define HANDLE_WM_KILLFOCUS(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3879  ((fn)((hwnd), (HWND)(wParam)), 0L)
3880 # endif

3883  ((fn)((hwnd), (HWND)(lParam), (UINT)(LOWORD(wParam)), (int)(short)HIWORD(wParam)), 0L)
3884 # endif

3886 # define HANDLE_WM_DROPFILES(hwnd, wParam, lParam, fn) \
3887  ((fn)((hwnd), (HDROP)(wParam)), 0L)
3888 # endif

3891  ((fn)((hwnd), (TCHAR)(wParam), (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam)), 0L)

3924  * UINT_PTR as unsigned long. */

3945 typedef struct _DllVersionInfo
3946 {
3947  DWORD cbSize;
3948  DWORD dwMajorVersion;
3949  DWORD dwMinorVersion;
3950  DWORD dwBuildNumber;
3951  DWORD dwPlatformID;
3952 } DLLVERSIONINFO;

3958 typedef struct tagTOOLINFOA_NEW
3959 {
3960  UINT cbSize;
3961  UINT uFlags;
3962  HWND hwnd;
3963  UINT_PTR uId;
3964  RECT rect;

3970 typedef struct tagNMTTDISPINFO_NEW
3971 {

3973  LPSTR lpszText;
3974  char szText[80];
3975  HINSTANCE hinst;
3976  UINT uFlags;
3977  LPARAM lParam;

3979 
3980 typedef struct tagTOOLINFOW_NEW
3981 {
3982  UINT cbSize;
3983  UINT uFlags;
3984  HWND hwnd;
3985  UINT_PTR uId;
3986  RECT rect;
3987  HINSTANCE hinst;
3988  LPWSTR lpszText;
3989  LPARAM lParam;
3990  void *lpReserved;
3991 } TOOLINFOW_NEW;
3992 
3993 typedef struct tagNMTTDISPINFOW_NEW
3994 {
3995  NMHDR hdr;
3996  LPWSTR lpszText;
3997  WCHAR szText[80];
3998  HINSTANCE hinst;
3999  UINT uFlags;
4000  LPARAM lParam;
4001 } NMTTDISPINFOW_NEW;
4002 
4003 
4004 typedef HRESULT (WINAPI* DLLGETVERSIONPROC)(DLLVERSIONINFO *);
4005 #ifndef TTM_SETMAXTIPWIDTH
4006 # define TTM_SETMAXTIPWIDTH (WM_USER+24)
4007 #endif
4008 
4009 #ifndef TTF_DI_SETITEM
4010 # define TTF_DI_SETITEM 0x8000
4011 #endif
4012 
4013 #ifndef TTN_GETDISPINFO
4014 # define TTN_GETDISPINFO (TTN_FIRST - 0)
4015 #endif
4016 
4017 #endif /* defined(FEAT_BEVAL_GUI) */
4018 
4019 #if defined(FEAT_TOOLBAR) || defined(FEAT_GUI_TABLINE)
4020 /* Older MSVC compilers don't have LPNMTTDISPINFO[AW] thus we need to define
4021  * it here if LPNMTTDISPINFO isn't defined.
4022  * MingW doesn't define LPNMTTDISPINFO but typedefs it. Thus we need to check
4023  * _MSC_VER. */
4024 # if !defined(LPNMTTDISPINFO) && defined(_MSC_VER)
4025 typedef struct tagNMTTDISPINFOA {
4026  NMHDR hdr;
4027  LPSTR lpszText;
4028  char szText[80];
4029  HINSTANCE hinst;
4030  UINT uFlags;
4031  LPARAM lParam;
4032 } NMTTDISPINFOA, *LPNMTTDISPINFOA;
4033 # define LPNMTTDISPINFO LPNMTTDISPINFOA
4034 
4035 typedef struct tagNMTTDISPINFOW {
4036  NMHDR hdr;
4037  LPWSTR lpszText;
4038  WCHAR szText[80];
4039  HINSTANCE hinst;
4040  UINT uFlags;
4041  LPARAM lParam;
4042 } NMTTDISPINFOW, *LPNMTTDISPINFOW;
4043 # endif
4044 #endif
4045 
4046 #ifndef TTN_GETDISPINFOW

4048 #endif

4054 #endif

4056 /*
4057  * Use the system font for dialogs and tear-off menus. Remove this line to
4058  * use DLG_FONT_NAME.
4059  */
4060 #define USE_SYSMENU_FONT
4061 
4062 #define VIM_NAME "vim"
4063 #define VIM_CLASSW L"Vim"
4064 
4065 /* Initial size for the dialog template. For gui_mch_dialog() it's fixed,
4066  * thus there should be room for every dialog. For tearoffs it's made bigger
4067  * when needed. */
4068 #define DLG_ALLOC_SIZE 16 * 1024
4069

4071  * stuff for dialogs, menus, tearoffs etc.
4072  */
4073 static PWORD
4074 add_dialog_element(
4075  PWORD p,
4076  DWORD lStyle,
4077  WORD x,
4078  WORD y,
4079  WORD w,
4080  WORD h,
4081  WORD Id,
4082  WORD clss,
4083  const char *caption);
4084 static LPWORD lpwAlign(LPWORD);
4085 static int nCopyAnsiToWideChar(LPWORD, LPSTR, BOOL);
4086 #if defined(FEAT_MENU) && defined(FEAT_TEAROFF)
4087 static void gui_mch_tearoff(char_u *title, vimmenu_T *menu, int initX, int initY);

4122 static HINSTANCE hLibImm = NULL;
4123 static LONG (WINAPI *pImmGetCompositionStringA)(HIMC, DWORD, LPVOID, DWORD);
4124 static LONG (WINAPI *pImmGetCompositionStringW)(HIMC, DWORD, LPVOID, DWORD);
4125 static HIMC (WINAPI *pImmGetContext)(HWND);
4126 static HIMC (WINAPI *pImmAssociateContext)(HWND, HIMC);
4127 static BOOL (WINAPI *pImmReleaseContext)(HWND, HIMC);
4128 static BOOL (WINAPI *pImmGetOpenStatus)(HIMC);
4129 static BOOL (WINAPI *pImmSetOpenStatus)(HIMC, BOOL);

4131 static BOOL (WINAPI *pImmSetCompositionFontW)(HIMC, LPLOGFONTW);
4132 static BOOL (WINAPI *pImmSetCompositionWindow)(HIMC, LPCOMPOSITIONFORM);

4134 static BOOL (WINAPI *pImmSetConversionStatus)(HIMC, DWORD, DWORD);
4135 static void dyn_imm_load(void);

4141 # define pImmReleaseContext ImmReleaseContext

4143 # define pImmSetOpenStatus ImmSetOpenStatus

4147 # define pImmGetConversionStatus ImmGetConversionStatus
4148 # define pImmSetConversionStatus ImmSetConversionStatus
4149 #endif
4150 
4151 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
4152 /*
4153  * Figure out how high the menu bar is at the moment.
4154  */
4155  static int
4156 gui_mswin_get_menu_height(
4157  int fix_window) /* If TRUE, resize window if menu height changed */
4158 {
4159  static int old_menu_height = -1;
4160 
4161  RECT rc1, rc2;
4162  int num;
4163  int menu_height;
4164 
4165  if (gui.menu_is_active)
4166  num = GetMenuItemCount(s_menuBar);
4167  else
4168  num = 0;
4169 
4170  if (num == 0)
4171  menu_height = 0;
4172  else if (IsMinimized(s_hwnd))
4173  {
4174  /* The height of the menu cannot be determined while the window is
4175  * minimized. Take the previous height if the menu is changed in that
4176  * state, to avoid that Vim's vertical window size accidentally
4177  * increases due to the unaccounted-for menu height. */
4178  menu_height = old_menu_height == -1 ? 0 : old_menu_height;
4179  }
4180  else
4181  {
4182  /*
4183  * In case 'lines' is set in _vimrc/_gvimrc window width doesn't
4184  * seem to have been set yet, so menu wraps in default window
4185  * width which is very narrow. Instead just return height of a
4186  * single menu item. Will still be wrong when the menu really
4187  * should wrap over more than one line.
4188  */
4189  GetMenuItemRect(s_hwnd, s_menuBar, 0, &rc1);
4190  if (gui.starting)
4191  menu_height = rc1.bottom - rc1.top + 1;
4192  else
4193  {
4194  GetMenuItemRect(s_hwnd, s_menuBar, num - 1, &rc2);
4195  menu_height = rc2.bottom - rc1.top + 1;
4196  }
4197  }
4198 
4199  if (fix_window && menu_height != old_menu_height)
4200  gui_set_shellsize(FALSE, FALSE, RESIZE_VERT);
4201  old_menu_height = menu_height;
4202 
4203  return menu_height;
4204 }
4205 #endif /*FEAT_MENU*/
4206 
4207 
4208 /*
4209  * Setup for the Intellimouse
4210  */
4211  static void
4212 init_mouse_wheel(void)
4213 {
4214 
4215 #ifndef SPI_GETWHEELSCROLLLINES
4216 # define SPI_GETWHEELSCROLLLINES 104
4217 #endif
4218 #ifndef SPI_SETWHEELSCROLLLINES
4219 # define SPI_SETWHEELSCROLLLINES 105
4220 #endif
4221 
4222 #define VMOUSEZ_CLASSNAME "MouseZ" /* hidden wheel window class */
4223 #define VMOUSEZ_TITLE "Magellan MSWHEEL" /* hidden wheel window title */
4224 #define VMSH_MOUSEWHEEL "MSWHEEL_ROLLMSG"
4225 #define VMSH_SCROLL_LINES "MSH_SCROLL_LINES_MSG"
4226 
4227  mouse_scroll_lines = 3; /* reasonable default */
4228 
4229  /* if NT 4.0+ (or Win98) get scroll lines directly from system */
4230  SystemParametersInfo(SPI_GETWHEELSCROLLLINES, 0,
4231  &mouse_scroll_lines, 0);
4232 }
4233 
4234 
4235 /* Intellimouse wheel handler */
4236  static void
4237 _OnMouseWheel(
4238  HWND hwnd,
4239  short zDelta)
4240 {
4241 /* Treat a mouse wheel event as if it were a scroll request */
4242  int i;
4243  int size;
4244  HWND hwndCtl;
4245 
4246  if (curwin->w_scrollbars[SBAR_RIGHT].id != 0)
4247  {
4248  hwndCtl = curwin->w_scrollbars[SBAR_RIGHT].id;
4249  size = curwin->w_scrollbars[SBAR_RIGHT].size;
4250  }
4251  else if (curwin->w_scrollbars[SBAR_LEFT].id != 0)
4252  {
4253  hwndCtl = curwin->w_scrollbars[SBAR_LEFT].id;
4254  size = curwin->w_scrollbars[SBAR_LEFT].size;
4255  }
4256  else
4257  return;
4258 
4259  size = curwin->w_height;
4260  if (mouse_scroll_lines == 0)
4261  init_mouse_wheel();
4262 
4263  mch_disable_flush();
4264  if (mouse_scroll_lines > 0
4265  && mouse_scroll_lines < (size > 2 ? size - 2 : 1))
4266  {
4267  for (i = mouse_scroll_lines; i > 0; --i)
4268  _OnScroll(hwnd, hwndCtl, zDelta >= 0 ? SB_LINEUP : SB_LINEDOWN, 0);
4269  }
4270  else
4271  _OnScroll(hwnd, hwndCtl, zDelta >= 0 ? SB_PAGEUP : SB_PAGEDOWN, 0);
4272  mch_enable_flush();
4273  gui_may_flush();
4274 }
4275 
4276 #ifdef USE_SYSMENU_FONT
4277 /*
4278  * Get Menu Font.
4279  * Return OK or FAIL.
4280  */
4281  static int
4282 gui_w32_get_menu_font(LOGFONTW *lf)
4283 {
4284  NONCLIENTMETRICSW nm;
4285 
4286  nm.cbSize = sizeof(NONCLIENTMETRICSW);
4287  if (!SystemParametersInfoW(
4288  SPI_GETNONCLIENTMETRICS,
4289  sizeof(NONCLIENTMETRICSW),
4290  &nm,
4291  0))
4292  return FAIL;
4293  *lf = nm.lfMenuFont;
4294  return OK;
4295 }
4296 #endif
4297 
4298 
4299 #if defined(FEAT_GUI_TABLINE) && defined(USE_SYSMENU_FONT)
4300 /*
4301  * Set the GUI tabline font to the system menu font
4302  */
4303  static void
4304 set_tabline_font(void)
4305 {
4306  LOGFONTW lfSysmenu;
4307  HFONT font;
4308  HWND hwnd;
4309  HDC hdc;
4310  HFONT hfntOld;
4311  TEXTMETRIC tm;
4312 
4313  if (gui_w32_get_menu_font(&lfSysmenu) != OK)
4314  return;
4315 
4316  font = CreateFontIndirectW(&lfSysmenu);
4317 
4318  SendMessage(s_tabhwnd, WM_SETFONT, (WPARAM)font, TRUE);
4319 
4320  /*
4321  * Compute the height of the font used for the tab text
4322  */
4323  hwnd = GetDesktopWindow();
4324  hdc = GetWindowDC(hwnd);
4325  hfntOld = SelectFont(hdc, font);
4326 
4327  GetTextMetrics(hdc, &tm);
4328 
4329  SelectFont(hdc, hfntOld);
4330  ReleaseDC(hwnd, hdc);
4331 
4332  /*
4333  * The space used by the tab border and the space between the tab label
4334  * and the tab border is included as 7.
4335  */
4336  gui.tabline_height = tm.tmHeight + tm.tmInternalLeading + 7;
4337 }
4338 #endif
4339 
4340 /*
4341  * Invoked when a setting was changed.
4342  */
4343  static LRESULT CALLBACK
4344 _OnSettingChange(UINT n)
4345 {
4346  if (n == SPI_SETWHEELSCROLLLINES)
4347  SystemParametersInfo(SPI_GETWHEELSCROLLLINES, 0,
4348  &mouse_scroll_lines, 0);
4349 #if defined(FEAT_GUI_TABLINE) && defined(USE_SYSMENU_FONT)
4350  if (n == SPI_SETNONCLIENTMETRICS)
4351  set_tabline_font();
4352 #endif
4353  return 0;
4354 }
4355 
4356 #ifdef FEAT_NETBEANS_INTG
4357  static void
4358 _OnWindowPosChanged(
4359  HWND hwnd,
4360  const LPWINDOWPOS lpwpos)
4361 {
4362  static int x = 0, y = 0, cx = 0, cy = 0;
4363  extern int WSInitialized;
4364 
4365  if (WSInitialized && (lpwpos->x != x || lpwpos->y != y
4366  || lpwpos->cx != cx || lpwpos->cy != cy))
4367  {
4368  x = lpwpos->x;
4369  y = lpwpos->y;
4370  cx = lpwpos->cx;
4371  cy = lpwpos->cy;
4372  netbeans_frame_moved(x, y);
4373  }
4374  /* Allow to send WM_SIZE and WM_MOVE */
4375  FORWARD_WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED(hwnd, lpwpos, MyWindowProc);
4376 }
4377 #endif
4378 
4379  static int
4380 _DuringSizing(
4381  UINT fwSide,
4382  LPRECT lprc)
4383 {
4384  int w, h;
4385  int valid_w, valid_h;
4386  int w_offset, h_offset;
4387 
4388  w = lprc->right - lprc->left;
4389  h = lprc->bottom - lprc->top;
4390  gui_mswin_get_valid_dimensions(w, h, &valid_w, &valid_h);
4391  w_offset = w - valid_w;
4392  h_offset = h - valid_h;
4393 
4394  if (fwSide == WMSZ_LEFT || fwSide == WMSZ_TOPLEFT
4395  || fwSide == WMSZ_BOTTOMLEFT)
4396  lprc->left += w_offset;
4397  else if (fwSide == WMSZ_RIGHT || fwSide == WMSZ_TOPRIGHT
4398  || fwSide == WMSZ_BOTTOMRIGHT)
4399  lprc->right -= w_offset;
4400 
4401  if (fwSide == WMSZ_TOP || fwSide == WMSZ_TOPLEFT
4402  || fwSide == WMSZ_TOPRIGHT)
4403  lprc->top += h_offset;
4404  else if (fwSide == WMSZ_BOTTOM || fwSide == WMSZ_BOTTOMLEFT
4405  || fwSide == WMSZ_BOTTOMRIGHT)
4406  lprc->bottom -= h_offset;
4407  return TRUE;
4408 }
4409 
4410 
4411 
4412  static LRESULT CALLBACK
4413 _WndProc(
4414  HWND hwnd,
4415  UINT uMsg,
4416  WPARAM wParam,
4417  LPARAM lParam)
4418 {
4419  /*
4420  TRACE("WndProc: hwnd = %08x, msg = %x, wParam = %x, lParam = %x\n",
4421  hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4422  */
4423 
4424  HandleMouseHide(uMsg, lParam);
4425 
4426  s_uMsg = uMsg;
4427  s_wParam = wParam;
4428  s_lParam = lParam;
4429 
4430  switch (uMsg)
4431  {
4432  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_DEADCHAR, _OnDeadChar);
4433  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_SYSDEADCHAR, _OnDeadChar);
4434  /* HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_ACTIVATE, _OnActivate); */
4435  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_CLOSE, _OnClose);
4436  /* HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_COMMAND, _OnCommand); */
4437  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_DESTROY, _OnDestroy);
4438  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_DROPFILES, _OnDropFiles);
4439  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_HSCROLL, _OnScroll);
4440  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_KILLFOCUS, _OnKillFocus);
4441 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
4442  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_COMMAND, _OnMenu);
4443 #endif
4444  /* HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_MOVE, _OnMove); */
4445  /* HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_NCACTIVATE, _OnNCActivate); */
4446  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_SETFOCUS, _OnSetFocus);
4447  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_SIZE, _OnSize);
4448  /* HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_SYSCOMMAND, _OnSysCommand); */
4449  /* HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_SYSKEYDOWN, _OnAltKey); */
4450  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_VSCROLL, _OnScroll);
4451  // HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING, _OnWindowPosChanging);
4452  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_ACTIVATEAPP, _OnActivateApp);
4453 #ifdef FEAT_NETBEANS_INTG
4454  HANDLE_MSG(hwnd, WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGED, _OnWindowPosChanged);
4455 #endif
4456 
4457 #ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
4458  case WM_RBUTTONUP:
4459  {
4460  if (gui_mch_showing_tabline())
4461  {
4462  POINT pt;
4463  RECT rect;
4464 
4465  /*
4466  * If the cursor is on the tabline, display the tab menu
4467  */
4468  GetCursorPos((LPPOINT)&pt);
4469  GetWindowRect(s_textArea, &rect);
4470  if (pt.y < rect.top)
4471  {
4472  show_tabline_popup_menu();
4473  return 0L;
4474  }
4475  }
4476  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4477  }
4478  case WM_LBUTTONDBLCLK:
4479  {
4480  /*
4481  * If the user double clicked the tabline, create a new tab
4482  */
4483  if (gui_mch_showing_tabline())
4484  {
4485  POINT pt;
4486  RECT rect;
4487 
4488  GetCursorPos((LPPOINT)&pt);
4489  GetWindowRect(s_textArea, &rect);
4490  if (pt.y < rect.top)
4491  send_tabline_menu_event(0, TABLINE_MENU_NEW);
4492  }
4493  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4494  }
4495 #endif
4496 
4497  case WM_QUERYENDSESSION: /* System wants to go down. */
4498  gui_shell_closed(); /* Will exit when no changed buffers. */
4499  return FALSE; /* Do NOT allow system to go down. */
4500 
4501  case WM_ENDSESSION:
4502  if (wParam) /* system only really goes down when wParam is TRUE */
4503  {
4504  _OnEndSession();
4505  return 0L;
4506  }
4507  break;
4508 
4509  case WM_CHAR:
4510  /* Don't use HANDLE_MSG() for WM_CHAR, it truncates wParam to a single
4511  * byte while we want the UTF-16 character value. */
4512  _OnChar(hwnd, (UINT)wParam, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam));
4513  return 0L;
4514 
4515  case WM_SYSCHAR:
4516  /*
4517  * if 'winaltkeys' is "no", or it's "menu" and it's not a menu
4518  * shortcut key, handle like a typed ALT key, otherwise call Windows
4519  * ALT key handling.
4520  */
4521 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
4522  if ( !gui.menu_is_active
4523  || p_wak[0] == 'n'
4524  || (p_wak[0] == 'm' && !gui_is_menu_shortcut((int)wParam))
4525  )
4526 #endif
4527  {
4528  _OnSysChar(hwnd, (UINT)wParam, (int)(short)LOWORD(lParam));
4529  return 0L;
4530  }
4531 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
4532  else
4533  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4534 #endif
4535 
4536  case WM_SYSKEYUP:
4537 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
4538  /* This used to be done only when menu is active: ALT key is used for
4539  * that. But that caused problems when menu is disabled and using
4540  * Alt-Tab-Esc: get into a strange state where no mouse-moved events
4541  * are received, mouse pointer remains hidden. */
4542  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4543 #else
4544  return 0L;
4545 #endif
4546 
4547  case WM_SIZING: /* HANDLE_MSG doesn't seem to handle this one */
4548  return _DuringSizing((UINT)wParam, (LPRECT)lParam);
4549 
4550  case WM_MOUSEWHEEL:
4551  _OnMouseWheel(hwnd, HIWORD(wParam));
4552  return 0L;
4553 
4554  /* Notification for change in SystemParametersInfo() */
4555  case WM_SETTINGCHANGE:
4556  return _OnSettingChange((UINT)wParam);
4557 
4558 #if defined(FEAT_TOOLBAR) || defined(FEAT_GUI_TABLINE)
4559  case WM_NOTIFY:
4560  switch (((LPNMHDR) lParam)->code)
4561  {
4562  case TTN_GETDISPINFOW:
4563  case TTN_GETDISPINFO:
4564  {
4565  LPNMHDR hdr = (LPNMHDR)lParam;
4566  char_u *str = NULL;
4567  static void *tt_text = NULL;
4568 
4569  VIM_CLEAR(tt_text);
4570 
4571 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
4572  if (gui_mch_showing_tabline()
4573  && hdr->hwndFrom == TabCtrl_GetToolTips(s_tabhwnd))
4574  {
4575  POINT pt;
4576  /*
4577  * Mouse is over the GUI tabline. Display the
4578  * tooltip for the tab under the cursor
4579  *
4580  * Get the cursor position within the tab control
4581  */
4582  GetCursorPos(&pt);
4583  if (ScreenToClient(s_tabhwnd, &pt) != 0)
4584  {
4585  TCHITTESTINFO htinfo;
4586  int idx;
4587 
4588  /*
4589  * Get the tab under the cursor
4590  */
4591  htinfo.pt.x = pt.x;
4592  htinfo.pt.y = pt.y;
4593  idx = TabCtrl_HitTest(s_tabhwnd, &htinfo);
4594  if (idx != -1)
4595  {
4596  tabpage_T *tp;
4597 
4598  tp = find_tabpage(idx + 1);
4599  if (tp != NULL)
4600  {
4601  get_tabline_label(tp, TRUE);
4602  str = NameBuff;
4603  }
4604  }
4605  }
4606  }
4607 # endif
4608 # ifdef FEAT_TOOLBAR
4609 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
4610  else
4611 # endif
4612  {
4613  UINT idButton;
4614  vimmenu_T *pMenu;
4615 
4616  idButton = (UINT) hdr->idFrom;
4617  pMenu = gui_mswin_find_menu(root_menu, idButton);
4618  if (pMenu)
4619  str = pMenu->strings[MENU_INDEX_TIP];
4620  }
4621 # endif
4622  if (str != NULL)
4623  {
4624  if (hdr->code == TTN_GETDISPINFOW)
4625  {
4626  LPNMTTDISPINFOW lpdi = (LPNMTTDISPINFOW)lParam;
4627 
4628  /* Set the maximum width, this also enables using
4629  * \n for line break. */
4630  SendMessage(lpdi->hdr.hwndFrom, TTM_SETMAXTIPWIDTH,
4631  0, 500);
4632 
4633  tt_text = enc_to_utf16(str, NULL);
4634  lpdi->lpszText = tt_text;
4635  /* can't show tooltip if failed */
4636  }
4637  else
4638  {
4639  LPNMTTDISPINFO lpdi = (LPNMTTDISPINFO)lParam;
4640 
4641  /* Set the maximum width, this also enables using
4642  * \n for line break. */
4643  SendMessage(lpdi->hdr.hwndFrom, TTM_SETMAXTIPWIDTH,
4644  0, 500);
4645 
4646  if (STRLEN(str) < sizeof(lpdi->szText)
4647  || ((tt_text = vim_strsave(str)) == NULL))
4648  vim_strncpy((char_u *)lpdi->szText, str,
4649  sizeof(lpdi->szText) - 1);
4650  else
4651  lpdi->lpszText = tt_text;
4652  }
4653  }
4654  }
4655  break;
4656 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
4657  case TCN_SELCHANGE:
4658  if (gui_mch_showing_tabline()
4659  && ((LPNMHDR)lParam)->hwndFrom == s_tabhwnd)
4660  {
4661  send_tabline_event(TabCtrl_GetCurSel(s_tabhwnd) + 1);
4662  return 0L;
4663  }
4664  break;
4665 
4666  case NM_RCLICK:
4667  if (gui_mch_showing_tabline()
4668  && ((LPNMHDR)lParam)->hwndFrom == s_tabhwnd)
4669  {
4670  show_tabline_popup_menu();
4671  return 0L;
4672  }
4673  break;
4674 # endif
4675  default:
4676 # ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
4677  if (gui_mch_showing_tabline()
4678  && ((LPNMHDR)lParam)->hwndFrom == s_tabhwnd)
4679  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4680 # endif
4681  break;
4682  }
4683  break;
4684 #endif
4685 #if defined(MENUHINTS) && defined(FEAT_MENU)
4686  case WM_MENUSELECT:
4687  if (((UINT) HIWORD(wParam)
4688  & (0xffff ^ (MF_MOUSESELECT + MF_BITMAP + MF_POPUP)))
4689  == MF_HILITE
4690  && (State & CMDLINE) == 0)
4691  {
4692  UINT idButton;
4693  vimmenu_T *pMenu;
4694  static int did_menu_tip = FALSE;
4695 
4696  if (did_menu_tip)
4697  {
4698  msg_clr_cmdline();
4699  setcursor();
4700  out_flush();
4701  did_menu_tip = FALSE;
4702  }
4703 
4704  idButton = (UINT)LOWORD(wParam);
4705  pMenu = gui_mswin_find_menu(root_menu, idButton);
4706  if (pMenu != NULL && pMenu->strings[MENU_INDEX_TIP] != 0
4707  && GetMenuState(s_menuBar, pMenu->id, MF_BYCOMMAND) != -1)
4708  {
4709  ++msg_hist_off;
4710  msg((char *)pMenu->strings[MENU_INDEX_TIP]);
4711  --msg_hist_off;
4712  setcursor();
4713  out_flush();
4714  did_menu_tip = TRUE;
4715  }
4716  return 0L;
4717  }
4718  break;
4719 #endif
4720  case WM_NCHITTEST:
4721  {
4722  LRESULT result;
4723  int x, y;
4724  int xPos = GET_X_LPARAM(lParam);
4725 
4726  result = MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4727  if (result == HTCLIENT)
4728  {
4729 #ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
4730  if (gui_mch_showing_tabline())
4731  {
4732  int yPos = GET_Y_LPARAM(lParam);
4733  RECT rct;
4734 
4735  /* If the cursor is on the GUI tabline, don't process this
4736  * event */
4737  GetWindowRect(s_textArea, &rct);
4738  if (yPos < rct.top)
4739  return result;
4740  }
4741 #endif
4742  (void)gui_mch_get_winpos(&x, &y);
4743  xPos -= x;
4744 
4745  if (xPos < 48) /* <VN> TODO should use system metric? */
4746  return HTBOTTOMLEFT;
4747  else
4748  return HTBOTTOMRIGHT;
4749  }
4750  else
4751  return result;
4752  }
4753  /* break; notreached */
4754 
4755 #ifdef FEAT_MBYTE_IME
4756  case WM_IME_NOTIFY:
4757  if (!_OnImeNotify(hwnd, (DWORD)wParam, (DWORD)lParam))
4758  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4759  return 1L;
4760 
4761  case WM_IME_COMPOSITION:
4762  if (!_OnImeComposition(hwnd, wParam, lParam))
4763  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4764  return 1L;
4765 #endif
4766 
4767  default:
4768 #ifdef MSWIN_FIND_REPLACE
4769  if (uMsg == s_findrep_msg && s_findrep_msg != 0)
4770  _OnFindRepl();
4771 #endif
4772  return MyWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4773  }
4774 
4775  return DefWindowProc(hwnd, uMsg, wParam, lParam);
4776 }
4777 
4778 /*
4779  * End of call-back routines
4780  */
4781 
4782 /* parent window, if specified with -P */
4783 HWND vim_parent_hwnd = NULL;
4784 
4785  static BOOL CALLBACK
4786 FindWindowTitle(HWND hwnd, LPARAM lParam)
4787 {
4788  char buf[2048];
4789  char *title = (char *)lParam;
4790 
4791  if (GetWindowText(hwnd, buf, sizeof(buf)))
4792  {
4793  if (strstr(buf, title) != NULL)
4794  {
4795  /* Found it. Store the window ref. and quit searching if MDI
4796  * works. */
4797  vim_parent_hwnd = FindWindowEx(hwnd, NULL, "MDIClient", NULL);
4798  if (vim_parent_hwnd != NULL)
4799  return FALSE;
4800  }
4801  }
4802  return TRUE; /* continue searching */
4803 }
4804 
4805 /*
4806  * Invoked for '-P "title"' argument: search for parent application to open
4807  * our window in.
4808  */
4809  void
4810 gui_mch_set_parent(char *title)
4811 {
4812  EnumWindows(FindWindowTitle, (LPARAM)title);
4813  if (vim_parent_hwnd == NULL)
4814  {
4815  semsg(_("E671: Cannot find window title \"%s\""), title);
4816  mch_exit(2);
4817  }
4818 }
4819 
4820 #ifndef FEAT_OLE
4821  static void
4822 ole_error(char *arg)
4823 {
4824  char buf[IOSIZE];
4825 
4826 # ifdef VIMDLL
4827  gui.in_use = mch_is_gui_executable();
4828 # endif
4829 
4830  /* Can't use emsg() here, we have not finished initialisation yet. */
4831  vim_snprintf(buf, IOSIZE,
4832  _("E243: Argument not supported: \"-%s\"; Use the OLE version."),
4833  arg);
4834  mch_errmsg(buf);
4835 }
4836 #endif
4837 
4838 #if defined(GUI_MAY_SPAWN) || defined(PROTO)
4839  static char *
4840 gvim_error(void)
4841 {
4842  char *msg = _("E988: GUI cannot be used. Cannot execute gvim.exe.");
4843 
4844  if (starting)
4845  {
4846  mch_errmsg(msg);
4847  mch_errmsg("\n");
4848  mch_exit(2);
4849  }
4850  return msg;
4851 }
4852 
4853  char *
4854 gui_mch_do_spawn(char_u *arg)
4855 {
4856  int len;
4857 # if defined(FEAT_SESSION) && defined(EXPERIMENTAL_GUI_CMD)
4858  char_u *session = NULL;
4859  LPWSTR tofree1 = NULL;
4860 # endif
4861  WCHAR name[MAX_PATH];
4862  LPWSTR cmd, newcmd = NULL, p, warg, tofree2 = NULL;
4863  STARTUPINFOW si = {sizeof(si)};
4864  PROCESS_INFORMATION pi;
4865 
4866  if (!GetModuleFileNameW(g_hinst, name, MAX_PATH))
4867  goto error;
4868  p = wcsrchr(name, L'\\');
4869  if (p == NULL)
4870  goto error;
4871  // Replace the executable name from vim(d).exe to gvim(d).exe.
4872 # ifdef DEBUG
4873  wcscpy(p + 1, L"gvimd.exe");
4874 # else
4875  wcscpy(p + 1, L"gvim.exe");
4876 # endif
4877 
4878 # if defined(FEAT_SESSION) && defined(EXPERIMENTAL_GUI_CMD)
4879  if (starting)
4880 # endif
4881  {
4882  // Pass the command line to the new process.
4883  p = GetCommandLineW();
4884  // Skip 1st argument.
4885  while (*p && *p != L' ' && *p != L'\t')
4886  {
4887  if (*p == L'"')
4888  {
4889  while (*p && *p != L'"')
4890  ++p;
4891  if (*p)
4892  ++p;
4893  }
4894  else
4895  ++p;
4896  }
4897  cmd = p;
4898  }
4899 # if defined(FEAT_SESSION) && defined(EXPERIMENTAL_GUI_CMD)
4900  else
4901  {
4902  // Create a session file and pass it to the new process.
4903  LPWSTR wsession;
4904  char_u *savebg;
4905  int ret;
4906 
4907  session = vim_tempname('s', FALSE);
4908  if (session == NULL)
4909  goto error;
4910  savebg = p_bg;
4911  p_bg = vim_strsave((char_u *)"light"); // Set 'bg' to "light".
4912  ret = write_session_file(session);
4913  vim_free(p_bg);
4914  p_bg = savebg;
4915  if (!ret)
4916  goto error;
4917  wsession = enc_to_utf16(session, NULL);
4918  if (wsession == NULL)
4919  goto error;
4920  len = (int)wcslen(wsession) * 2 + 27 + 1;
4921  cmd = ALLOC_MULT(WCHAR, len);
4922  if (cmd == NULL)
4923  {
4924  vim_free(wsession);
4925  goto error;
4926  }
4927  tofree1 = cmd;
4928  _snwprintf(cmd, len, L" -S \"%s\" -c \"call delete('%s')\"",
4929  wsession, wsession);
4930  vim_free(wsession);
4931  }
4932 # endif
4933 
4934  // Check additional arguments to the `:gui` command.
4935  if (arg != NULL)
4936  {
4937  warg = enc_to_utf16(arg, NULL);
4938  if (warg == NULL)
4939  goto error;
4940  tofree2 = warg;
4941  }
4942  else
4943  warg = L"";
4944 
4945  // Set up the new command line.
4946  len = (int)wcslen(name) + (int)wcslen(cmd) + (int)wcslen(warg) + 4;
4947  newcmd = ALLOC_MULT(WCHAR, len);
4948  if (newcmd == NULL)
4949  goto error;
4950  _snwprintf(newcmd, len, L"\"%s\"%s %s", name, cmd, warg);
4951 
4952  // Spawn a new GUI process.
4953  if (!CreateProcessW(NULL, newcmd, NULL, NULL, TRUE, 0,
4954  NULL, NULL, &si, &pi))
4955  goto error;
4956  CloseHandle(pi.hProcess);
4957  CloseHandle(pi.hThread);
4958  mch_exit(0);
4959 
4960 error:
4961 # if defined(FEAT_SESSION) && defined(EXPERIMENTAL_GUI_CMD)
4962  if (session)
4963  mch_remove(session);
4964  vim_free(session);
4965  vim_free(tofree1);
4966 # endif
4967  vim_free(newcmd);
4968  vim_free(tofree2);
4969  return gvim_error();
4970 }
4971 #endif
4972 
4973 /*
4974  * Parse the GUI related command-line arguments. Any arguments used are
4975  * deleted from argv, and *argc is decremented accordingly. This is called
4976  * when vim is started, whether or not the GUI has been started.
4977  */
4978  void
4979 gui_mch_prepare(int *argc, char **argv)
4980 {
4981  int silent = FALSE;
4982  int idx;
4983 
4984  /* Check for special OLE command line parameters */
4985  if ((*argc == 2 || *argc == 3) && (argv[1][0] == '-' || argv[1][0] == '/'))
4986  {
4987  /* Check for a "-silent" argument first. */
4988  if (*argc == 3 && STRICMP(argv[1] + 1, "silent") == 0
4989  && (argv[2][0] == '-' || argv[2][0] == '/'))
4990  {
4991  silent = TRUE;
4992  idx = 2;
4993  }
4994  else
4995  idx = 1;
4996 
4997  /* Register Vim as an OLE Automation server */
4998  if (STRICMP(argv[idx] + 1, "register") == 0)
4999  {
5000 #ifdef FEAT_OLE
5001  RegisterMe(silent);
5002  mch_exit(0);
5003 #else
5004  if (!silent)
5005  ole_error("register");
5006  mch_exit(2);
5007 #endif
5008  }
5009 
5010  /* Unregister Vim as an OLE Automation server */
5011  if (STRICMP(argv[idx] + 1, "unregister") == 0)
5012  {
5013 #ifdef FEAT_OLE
5014  UnregisterMe(!silent);
5015  mch_exit(0);
5016 #else
5017  if (!silent)
5018  ole_error("unregister");
5019  mch_exit(2);
5020 #endif
5021  }
5022 
5023  /* Ignore an -embedding argument. It is only relevant if the
5024  * application wants to treat the case when it is started manually
5025  * differently from the case where it is started via automation (and
5026  * we don't).
5027  */
5028  if (STRICMP(argv[idx] + 1, "embedding") == 0)
5029  {
5030 #ifdef FEAT_OLE
5031  *argc = 1;
5032 #else
5033  ole_error("embedding");
5034  mch_exit(2);
5035 #endif
5036  }
5037  }
5038 
5039 #ifdef FEAT_OLE
5040  {
5041  int bDoRestart = FALSE;
5042 
5043  InitOLE(&bDoRestart);
5044  /* automatically exit after registering */
5045  if (bDoRestart)
5046  mch_exit(0);
5047  }
5048 #endif
5049 
5050 #ifdef FEAT_NETBEANS_INTG
5051  {
5052  /* stolen from gui_x11.c */
5053  int arg;
5054 
5055  for (arg = 1; arg < *argc; arg++)
5056  if (strncmp("-nb", argv[arg], 3) == 0)
5057  {
5058  netbeansArg = argv[arg];
5059  mch_memmove(&argv[arg], &argv[arg + 1],
5060  (--*argc - arg) * sizeof(char *));
5061  argv[*argc] = NULL;
5062  break; /* enough? */
5063  }
5064  }
5065 #endif
5066 }
5067 
5068 /*
5069  * Initialise the GUI. Create all the windows, set up all the call-backs
5070  * etc.
5071  */
5072  int
5073 gui_mch_init(void)
5074 {
5075  const WCHAR szVimWndClassW[] = VIM_CLASSW;
5076  const WCHAR szTextAreaClassW[] = L"VimTextArea";
5077  WNDCLASSW wndclassw;
5078 #ifdef GLOBAL_IME
5079  ATOM atom;
5080 #endif
5081 
5082  /* Return here if the window was already opened (happens when
5083  * gui_mch_dialog() is called early). */
5084  if (s_hwnd != NULL)
5085  goto theend;
5086 
5087  /*
5088  * Load the tearoff bitmap
5089  */
5090 #ifdef FEAT_TEAROFF
5091  s_htearbitmap = LoadBitmap(g_hinst, "IDB_TEAROFF");
5092 #endif
5093 
5094  gui.scrollbar_width = GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXVSCROLL);
5095  gui.scrollbar_height = GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYHSCROLL);
5096 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
5097  gui.menu_height = 0; /* Windows takes care of this */
5098 #endif
5099  gui.border_width = 0;
5100 
5101  s_brush = CreateSolidBrush(GetSysColor(COLOR_BTNFACE));
5102 
5103  /* First try using the wide version, so that we can use any title.
5104  * Otherwise only characters in the active codepage will work. */
5105  if (GetClassInfoW(g_hinst, szVimWndClassW, &wndclassw) == 0)
5106  {
5107  wndclassw.style = CS_DBLCLKS;
5108  wndclassw.lpfnWndProc = _WndProc;
5109  wndclassw.cbClsExtra = 0;
5110  wndclassw.cbWndExtra = 0;
5111  wndclassw.hInstance = g_hinst;
5112  wndclassw.hIcon = LoadIcon(wndclassw.hInstance, "IDR_VIM");
5113  wndclassw.hCursor = LoadCursor(NULL, IDC_ARROW);
5114  wndclassw.hbrBackground = s_brush;
5115  wndclassw.lpszMenuName = NULL;
5116  wndclassw.lpszClassName = szVimWndClassW;
5117 
5118  if ((
5119 #ifdef GLOBAL_IME
5120  atom =
5121 #endif
5122  RegisterClassW(&wndclassw)) == 0)
5123  return FAIL;
5124  }
5125 
5126  if (vim_parent_hwnd != NULL)
5127  {
5128 #ifdef HAVE_TRY_EXCEPT
5129  __try
5130  {
5131 #endif
5132  // Open inside the specified parent window.
5133  // TODO: last argument should point to a CLIENTCREATESTRUCT
5134  // structure.
5135  s_hwnd = CreateWindowExW(
5136  WS_EX_MDICHILD,
5137  szVimWndClassW, L"Vim MSWindows GUI",
5138  WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW | WS_CHILD
5139  | WS_CLIPSIBLINGS | WS_CLIPCHILDREN | 0xC000,
5140  gui_win_x == -1 ? CW_USEDEFAULT : gui_win_x,
5141  gui_win_y == -1 ? CW_USEDEFAULT : gui_win_y,
5142  100, // Any value will do
5143  100, // Any value will do
5144  vim_parent_hwnd, NULL,
5145  g_hinst, NULL);
5146 #ifdef HAVE_TRY_EXCEPT
5147  }
5148  __except(EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER)
5149  {
5150  /* NOP */
5151  }
5152 #endif
5153  if (s_hwnd == NULL)
5154  {
5155  emsg(_("E672: Unable to open window inside MDI application"));
5156  mch_exit(2);
5157  }
5158  }
5159  else
5160  {
5161  /* If the provided windowid is not valid reset it to zero, so that it
5162  * is ignored and we open our own window. */
5163  if (IsWindow((HWND)win_socket_id) <= 0)
5164  win_socket_id = 0;
5165 
5166  /* Create a window. If win_socket_id is not zero without border and
5167  * titlebar, it will be reparented below. */
5168  s_hwnd = CreateWindowW(
5169  szVimWndClassW, L"Vim MSWindows GUI",
5170  (win_socket_id == 0 ? WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW : WS_POPUP)
5171  | WS_CLIPSIBLINGS | WS_CLIPCHILDREN,
5172  gui_win_x == -1 ? CW_USEDEFAULT : gui_win_x,
5173  gui_win_y == -1 ? CW_USEDEFAULT : gui_win_y,
5174  100, /* Any value will do */
5175  100, /* Any value will do */
5176  NULL, NULL,
5177  g_hinst, NULL);
5178  if (s_hwnd != NULL && win_socket_id != 0)
5179  {
5180  SetParent(s_hwnd, (HWND)win_socket_id);
5181  ShowWindow(s_hwnd, SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED);
5182  }
5183  }
5184 
5185  if (s_hwnd == NULL)
5186  return FAIL;
5187 
5188 #ifdef GLOBAL_IME
5189  global_ime_init(atom, s_hwnd);
5190 #endif
5191 #if defined(FEAT_MBYTE_IME) && defined(DYNAMIC_IME)
5192  dyn_imm_load();
5193 #endif
5194 
5195  /* Create the text area window */
5196  if (GetClassInfoW(g_hinst, szTextAreaClassW, &wndclassw) == 0)
5197  {
5198  wndclassw.style = CS_OWNDC;
5199  wndclassw.lpfnWndProc = _TextAreaWndProc;
5200  wndclassw.cbClsExtra = 0;
5201  wndclassw.cbWndExtra = 0;
5202  wndclassw.hInstance = g_hinst;
5203  wndclassw.hIcon = NULL;
5204  wndclassw.hCursor = LoadCursor(NULL, IDC_ARROW);
5205  wndclassw.hbrBackground = NULL;
5206  wndclassw.lpszMenuName = NULL;
5207  wndclassw.lpszClassName = szTextAreaClassW;
5208 
5209  if (RegisterClassW(&wndclassw) == 0)
5210  return FAIL;
5211  }
5212 
5213  s_textArea = CreateWindowExW(
5214  0,
5215  szTextAreaClassW, L"Vim text area",
5216  WS_CHILD | WS_VISIBLE, 0, 0,
5217  100, // Any value will do for now
5218  100, // Any value will do for now
5219  s_hwnd, NULL,
5220  g_hinst, NULL);
5221 
5222  if (s_textArea == NULL)
5223  return FAIL;
5224 
5225 #ifdef FEAT_LIBCALL
5226  /* Try loading an icon from $RUNTIMEPATH/bitmaps/vim.ico. */
5227  {
5228  HANDLE hIcon = NULL;
5229 
5230  if (mch_icon_load(&hIcon) == OK && hIcon != NULL)
5231  SendMessage(s_hwnd, WM_SETICON, ICON_SMALL, (LPARAM)hIcon);
5232  }
5233 #endif
5234 
5235 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
5236  s_menuBar = CreateMenu();
5237 #endif
5238  s_hdc = GetDC(s_textArea);
5239 
5240  DragAcceptFiles(s_hwnd, TRUE);
5241 
5242  /* Do we need to bother with this? */
5243  /* m_fMouseAvail = GetSystemMetrics(SM_MOUSEPRESENT); */
5244 
5245  /* Get background/foreground colors from the system */
5246  gui_mch_def_colors();
5247 
5248  /* Get the colors from the "Normal" group (set in syntax.c or in a vimrc
5249  * file) */
5250  set_normal_colors();
5251 
5252  /*
5253  * Check that none of the colors are the same as the background color.
5254  * Then store the current values as the defaults.
5255  */
5256  gui_check_colors();
5257  gui.def_norm_pixel = gui.norm_pixel;
5258  gui.def_back_pixel = gui.back_pixel;
5259 
5260  /* Get the colors for the highlight groups (gui_check_colors() might have
5261  * changed them) */
5262  highlight_gui_started();
5263 
5264  /*
5265  * Start out by adding the configured border width into the border offset.
5266  */
5267  gui.border_offset = gui.border_width;
5268 
5269  /*
5270  * Set up for Intellimouse processing
5271  */
5272  init_mouse_wheel();
5273 
5274  /*
5275  * compute a couple of metrics used for the dialogs
5276  */
5277  get_dialog_font_metrics();
5278 #ifdef FEAT_TOOLBAR
5279  /*
5280  * Create the toolbar
5281  */
5282  initialise_toolbar();
5283 #endif
5284 #ifdef FEAT_GUI_TABLINE
5285  /*
5286  * Create the tabline
5287  */
5288  initialise_tabline();
5289 #endif
5290 #ifdef MSWIN_FIND_REPLACE
5291  /*
5292  * Initialise the dialog box stuff
5293  */
5294  s_findrep_msg = RegisterWindowMessage(FINDMSGSTRING);
5295 
5296  /* Initialise the struct */
5297  s_findrep_struct.lStructSize = sizeof(s_findrep_struct);
5298  s_findrep_struct.lpstrFindWhat = ALLOC_MULT(WCHAR, MSWIN_FR_BUFSIZE);
5299  s_findrep_struct.lpstrFindWhat[0] = NUL;
5300  s_findrep_struct.lpstrReplaceWith = ALLOC_MULT(WCHAR, MSWIN_FR_BUFSIZE);
5301  s_findrep_struct.lpstrReplaceWith[0] = NUL;
5302  s_findrep_struct.wFindWhatLen = MSWIN_FR_BUFSIZE;
5303  s_findrep_struct.wReplaceWithLen = MSWIN_FR_BUFSIZE;
5304 #endif
5305 
5306 #ifdef FEAT_EVAL
5307 # if !defined(_MSC_VER) || (_MSC_VER < 1400)
5308 /* Define HandleToLong for old MS and non-MS compilers if not defined. */
5309 # ifndef HandleToLong
5310 # define HandleToLong(h) ((long)(intptr_t)(h))
5311 # endif
5312 # endif
5313  /* set the v:windowid variable */
5314  set_vim_var_nr(VV_WINDOWID, HandleToLong(s_hwnd));
5315 #endif
5316 
5317 #ifdef FEAT_RENDER_OPTIONS
5318  if (p_rop)
5319  (void)gui_mch_set_rendering_options(p_rop);
5320 #endif
5321 
5322 theend:
5323  /* Display any pending error messages */
5324  display_errors();
5325 
5326  return OK;
5327 }
5328 
5329 /*
5330  * Get the size of the screen, taking position on multiple monitors into
5331  * account (if supported).
5332  */
5333  static void
5334 get_work_area(RECT *spi_rect)
5335 {
5336  HMONITOR mon;
5337  MONITORINFO moninfo;
5338 
5339  /* work out which monitor the window is on, and get *its* work area */
5340  mon = MonitorFromWindow(s_hwnd, MONITOR_DEFAULTTOPRIMARY);
5341  if (mon != NULL)
5342  {
5343  moninfo.cbSize = sizeof(MONITORINFO);
5344  if (GetMonitorInfo(mon, &moninfo))
5345  {
5346  *spi_rect = moninfo.rcWork;
5347  return;
5348  }
5349  }
5350  /* this is the old method... */
5351  SystemParametersInfo(SPI_GETWORKAREA, 0, spi_rect, 0);
5352 }
5353 
5354 /*
5355  * Set the size of the window to the given width and height in pixels.
5356  */
5357  void
5358 gui_mch_set_shellsize(
5359  int width,
5360  int height,
5361  int min_width UNUSED,
5362  int min_height UNUSED,
5363  int base_width UNUSED,
5364  int base_height UNUSED,
5365  int direction)
5366 {
5367  RECT workarea_rect;
5368  int win_width, win_height;
5369  WINDOWPLACEMENT wndpl;
5370 
5371  /* Try to keep window completely on screen. */
5372  /* Get position of the screen work area. This is the part that is not
5373  * used by the taskbar or appbars. */
5374  get_work_area(&workarea_rect);
5375 
5376  /* Get current position of our window. Note that the .left and .top are
5377  * relative to the work area. */
5378  wndpl.length = sizeof(WINDOWPLACEMENT);
5379  GetWindowPlacement(s_hwnd, &wndpl);
5380 
5381  /* Resizing a maximized window looks very strange, unzoom it first.
5382  * But don't do it when still starting up, it may have been requested in
5383  * the shortcut. */
5384  if (wndpl.showCmd == SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED && starting == 0)
5385  {
5386  ShowWindow(s_hwnd, SW_SHOWNORMAL);
5387  /* Need to get the settings of the normal window. */
5388  GetWindowPlacement(s_hwnd, &wndpl);
5389  }
5390 
5391  /* compute the size of the outside of the window */
5392  win_width = width + (GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXFRAME) +
5393  GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXPADDEDBORDER)) * 2;
5394  win_height = height + (GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYFRAME) +
5395  GetSystemMetrics(SM_CXPADDEDBORDER)) * 2
5396  + GetSystemMetrics(SM_CYCAPTION)
5397 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
5398  + gui_mswin_get_menu_height(FALSE)
5399 #endif
5400  ;
5401 
5402  /* The following should take care of keeping Vim on the same monitor, no
5403  * matter if the secondary monitor is left or right of the primary
5404  * monitor. */
5405  wndpl.rcNormalPosition.right = wndpl.rcNormalPosition.left + win_width;
5406  wndpl.rcNormalPosition.bottom = wndpl.rcNormalPosition.top + win_height;
5407 
5408  /* If the window is going off the screen, move it on to the screen. */
5409  if ((direction & RESIZE_HOR)
5410  && wndpl.rcNormalPosition.right > workarea_rect.right)
5411  OffsetRect(&wndpl.rcNormalPosition,
5412  workarea_rect.right - wndpl.rcNormalPosition.right, 0);
5413 
5414  if ((direction & RESIZE_HOR)
5415  && wndpl.rcNormalPosition.left < workarea_rect.left)
5416  OffsetRect(&wndpl.rcNormalPosition,
5417  workarea_rect.left - wndpl.rcNormalPosition.left, 0);
5418 
5419  if ((direction & RESIZE_VERT)
5420  && wndpl.rcNormalPosition.bottom > workarea_rect.bottom)
5421  OffsetRect(&wndpl.rcNormalPosition,
5422  0, workarea_rect.bottom - wndpl.rcNormalPosition.bottom);
5423 
5424  if ((direction & RESIZE_VERT)
5425  && wndpl.rcNormalPosition.top < workarea_rect.top)
5426  OffsetRect(&wndpl.rcNormalPosition,
5427  0, workarea_rect.top - wndpl.rcNormalPosition.top);
5428 
5429  /* set window position - we should use SetWindowPlacement rather than
5430  * SetWindowPos as the MSDN docs say the coord systems returned by
5431  * these two are not compatible. */
5432  SetWindowPlacement(s_hwnd, &wndpl);
5433 
5434  SetActiveWindow(s_hwnd);
5435  SetFocus(s_hwnd);
5436 
5437 #ifdef FEAT_MENU
5438  /* Menu may wrap differently now */
5439  gui_mswin_get_menu_height(!gui.starting);
5440 #endif
5441 }
5442 
5443 
5444  void
5445 gui_mch_set_scrollbar_thumb(
5446  scrollbar_T *sb,
5447  long val,
5448  long size,
5449  long max)
5450 {
5451  SCROLLINFO info;
5452 
5453  sb->scroll_shift = 0;
5454  while (max > 32767)
5455  {
5456  max = (max + 1) >> 1;
5457  val >>= 1;
5458  size >>= 1;
5459  ++sb->scroll_shift;
5460  }
5461 
5462  if (sb->scroll_shift > 0)
5463  ++size;
5464 
5465  info.cbSize = sizeof(info);
5466  info.fMask = SIF_POS | SIF_RANGE | SIF_PAGE;
5467  info.nPos = val;
5468  info.nMin = 0;
5469  info.nMax = max;
5470  info.nPage = size;
5471  SetScrollInfo(sb->id, SB_CTL, &info, TRUE);
5472 }
5473 
5474 
5475 /*
5476  * Set the current text font.
5477  */
5478  void
5479 gui_mch_set_font(GuiFont font)
5480 {
5481  gui.currFont = font;
5482 }
5483

5485 /*
5486  * Set the current text foreground color.
5487  */
5488  void
5489 gui_mch_set_fg_color(guicolor_T color)
5490 {
5491  gui.currFgColor = color;
5492 }
5493 
5494 /*
5495  * Set the current text background color.
5496  */
5497  void
5498 gui_mch_set_bg_color(guicolor_T color)
5499 {
5500  gui.currBgColor = color;
5501 }
5502 
5503 /*
5504  * Set the current text special color.
5505  */
5506  void
5507 gui_mch_set_sp_color(guicolor_T color)
5508 {
5509  gui.currSpColor = color;
5510 }
5511 
5512 #ifdef FEAT_MBYTE_IME
5513 /*
5514  * Multi-byte handling, originally by Sung-Hoon Baek.
5515  * First static functions (no prototypes generated).
5516  */
5517 # ifdef _MSC_VER
5518 # include <ime.h> /* Apparently not needed for Cygwin or MinGW. */
5519 # endif
5520 # include <imm.h>
5521 
5522 /*
5523  * handle WM_IME_NOTIFY message
5524  */
5525  static LRESULT
5526 _OnImeNotify(HWND hWnd, DWORD dwCommand, DWORD dwData UNUSED)
5527 {
5528  LRESULT lResult = 0;
5529  HIMC hImc;
5530 
5531  if (!pImmGetContext || (hImc = pImmGetContext(hWnd)) == (HIMC)0)
5532  return lResult;
5533  switch (dwCommand)
5534  {
5535  case IMN_SETOPENSTATUS:
5536  if (pImmGetOpenStatus(hImc))
5537  {
5538  pImmSetCompositionFontW(hImc, &norm_logfont);
5539  im_set_position(gui.row, gui.col);
5540 
5541  /* Disable langmap */
5542  State &= ~LANGMAP;
5543  if (State & INSERT)
5544  {
5545 #if defined(FEAT_KEYMAP)
5546  /* Unshown 'keymap' in status lines */
5547  if (curbuf->b_p_iminsert == B_IMODE_LMAP)
5548  {
5549  /* Save cursor position */
5550  int old_row = gui.row;
5551  int old_col = gui.col;
5552 
5553  // This must be called here before
5554  // status_redraw_curbuf(), otherwise the mode
5555  // message may appear in the wrong position.
5556  showmode();
5557  status_redraw_curbuf();
5558  update_screen(0);
5559  /* Restore cursor position */
5560  gui.row = old_row;
5561  gui.col = old_col;
5562  }
5563 #endif
5564  }
5565  }
5566  gui_update_cursor(TRUE, FALSE);
5567  gui_mch_flush();
5568  lResult = 0;
5569  break;
5570  }
5571  pImmReleaseContext(hWnd, hImc);
5572  return lResult;
5573 }
5574 
5575  static LRESULT
5576 _OnImeComposition(HWND hwnd, WPARAM dbcs UNUSED, LPARAM param)
5577 {
5578  char_u *ret;
5579  int len;
5580 
5581  if ((param & GCS_RESULTSTR) == 0) /* Composition unfinished. */
5582  return 0;
5583 
5584  ret = GetResultStr(hwnd, GCS_RESULTSTR, &len);
5585  if (ret != NULL)
5586  {
5587  add_to_input_buf_csi(ret, len);
5588  vim_free(ret);
5589  return 1;
5590  }
5591  return 0;
5592 }
5593 
5594 /*
5595  * get the current composition string, in UCS-2; *lenp is the number of
5596  * *lenp is the number of Unicode characters.
5597  */
5598  static short_u *
5599 GetCompositionString_inUCS2(HIMC hIMC, DWORD GCS, int *lenp)
5600 {
5601  LONG ret;
5602  LPWSTR wbuf = NULL;
5603  char_u *buf;
5604 
5605  if (!pImmGetContext)
5606  return NULL; /* no imm32.dll */
5607 
5608  /* Try Unicode; this'll always work on NT regardless of codepage. */
5609  ret = pImmGetCompositionStringW(hIMC, GCS, NULL, 0);
5610  if (ret == 0)
5611  return NULL; /* empty */
5612 
5613  if (ret > 0)
5614  {
5615  /* Allocate the requested buffer plus space for the NUL character. */
5616  wbuf = alloc(ret + sizeof(WCHAR));
5617  if (wbuf != NULL)
5618  {
5619  pImmGetCompositionStringW(hIMC, GCS, wbuf, ret);
5620  *lenp = ret / sizeof(WCHAR);
5621  }
5622  return (short_u *)wbuf;
5623  }
5624 
5625  /* ret < 0; we got an error, so try the ANSI version. This'll work
5626  * on 9x/ME, but only if the codepage happens to be set to whatever
5627  * we're inputting. */
5628  ret = pImmGetCompositionStringA(hIMC, GCS, NULL, 0);
5629  if (ret <= 0)
5630  return NULL; /* empty or error */
5631 
5632  buf = alloc(ret);
5633  if (buf == NULL)
5634  return NULL;
5635  pImmGetCompositionStringA(hIMC, GCS, buf, ret);
5636 
5637  /* convert from codepage to UCS-2 */
5638  MultiByteToWideChar_alloc(GetACP(), 0, (LPCSTR)buf, ret, &wbuf, lenp);
5639  vim_free(buf);
5640 
5641  return (short_u *)wbuf;
5642 }
5643 
5644 /*
5645  * void GetResultStr()
5646  *
5647  * This handles WM_IME_COMPOSITION with GCS_RESULTSTR flag on.
5648  * get complete composition string
5649  */
5650  static char_u *
5651 GetResultStr(HWND hwnd, int GCS, int *lenp)
5652 {
5653  HIMC hIMC; /* Input context handle. */
5654  short_u *buf = NULL;
5655  char_u *convbuf = NULL;
5656 
5657  if (!pImmGetContext || (hIMC = pImmGetContext(hwnd)) == (HIMC)0)
5658  return NULL;
5659 
5660  /* Reads in the composition string. */
5661  buf = GetCompositionString_inUCS2(hIMC, GCS, lenp);
5662  if (buf == NULL)
5663  return NULL;
5664 
5665  convbuf = utf16_to_enc(buf, lenp);
5666  pImmReleaseContext(hwnd, hIMC);
5667  vim_free(buf);
5668  return convbuf;
5669 }
5670 #endif
5671 
5672 /* For global functions we need prototypes. */
5673 #if defined(FEAT_MBYTE_IME) || defined(PROTO)
5674 
5675 /*
5676  * set font to IM.
5677  */
5678  void
5679 im_set_font(LOGFONTW *lf)
5680 {
5681  HIMC hImc;
5682 
5683  if (pImmGetContext && (hImc = pImmGetContext(s_hwnd)) != (HIMC)0)
5684  {
5685  pImmSetCompositionFontW(hImc, lf);
5686  pImmReleaseContext(s_hwnd, hImc);
5687  }
5688 }
5689 
5690 /*
5691  * Notify cursor position to IM.
5692  */
5693  void
5694 im_set_position(int row, int col)
5695 {
5696  HIMC hImc;
5697 
5698  if (pImmGetContext && (hImc = pImmGetContext(s_hwnd)) != (HIMC)0)
5699  {
5700  COMPOSITIONFORM cfs;
5701 
5702  cfs.dwStyle = CFS_POINT;
5703  cfs.ptCurrentPos.x = FILL_X(col);
5704  cfs.ptCurrentPos.y = FILL_Y(row);
5705  MapWindowPoints(s_textArea, s_hwnd, &cfs.ptCurrentPos, 1);
5706  pImmSetCompositionWindow(hImc, &cfs);
5707 
5708  pImmReleaseContext(s_hwnd, hImc);
5709  }
5710 }
5711 
5712 /*
5713  * Set IM status on ("active" is TRUE) or off ("active" is FALSE).
5714  */
5715  void
5716 im_set_active(int active)
5717 {
5718  HIMC hImc;
5719  static HIMC hImcOld = (HIMC)0;
5720 
5721  if (pImmGetContext) /* if NULL imm32.dll wasn't loaded (yet) */
5722  {
5723  if (p_imdisable)
5724  {
5725  if (hImcOld == (HIMC)0)
5726  {
5727  hImcOld = pImmGetContext(s_hwnd);
5728  if (hImcOld)
5729  pImmAssociateContext(s_hwnd, (HIMC)0);
5730  }
5731  active = FALSE;
5732  }
5733  else if (hImcOld != (HIMC)0)
5734  {
5735  pImmAssociateContext(s_hwnd, hImcOld);
5736  hImcOld = (HIMC)0;
5737  }
5738 
5739  hImc = pImmGetContext(s_hwnd);
5740  if (hImc)
5741  {
5742  /*
5743  * for Korean ime
5744  */
5745  HKL hKL = GetKeyboardLayout(0);
5746 
5747  if (LOWORD(hKL) == MAKELANGID(LANG_KOREAN, SUBLANG_KOREAN))
5748  {
5749  static DWORD dwConversionSaved = 0, dwSentenceSaved = 0;
5750  static BOOL bSaved = FALSE;
5751 
5752  if (active)
5753  {
5754  /* if we have a saved conversion status, restore it */
5755  if (bSaved)
5756  pImmSetConversionStatus(hImc, dwConversionSaved,
5757  dwSentenceSaved);
5758  bSaved = FALSE;
5759  }
5760  else
5761  {
5762  /* save conversion status and disable korean */
5763  if (pImmGetConversionStatus(hImc, &dwConversionSaved,
5764  &dwSentenceSaved))
5765  {
5766  bSaved = TRUE;
5767  pImmSetConversionStatus(hImc,
5768  dwConversionSaved & ~(IME_CMODE_NATIVE
5769  | IME_CMODE_FULLSHAPE),
5770  dwSentenceSaved);
5771  }
5772  }
5773  }
5774 
5775  pImmSetOpenStatus(hImc, active);
5776  pImmReleaseContext(s_hwnd, hImc);
5777  }
5778  }
5779 }
5780 
5781 /*
5782  * Get IM status. When IM is on, return not 0. Else return 0.
5783  */
5784  int
5785 im_get_status(void)
5786 {
5787  int status = 0;
5788  HIMC hImc;
5789 
5790  if (pImmGetContext && (hImc = pImmGetContext(s_hwnd)) != (HIMC)0)
5791  {
5792  status = pImmGetOpenStatus(hImc) ? 1 : 0;
5793  pImmReleaseContext(s_hwnd, hImc);
5794  }
5795  return status;
5796 }
5797 
5798 #endif /* FEAT_MBYTE_IME */
5799 
5800 #if !defined(FEAT_MBYTE_IME) && defined(GLOBAL_IME)
5801 /* Win32 with GLOBAL IME */
5802 
5803 /*
5804  * Notify cursor position to IM.
5805  */
5806  void
5807 im_set_position(int row, int col)
5808 {
5809  /* Win32 with GLOBAL IME */
5810  POINT p;
5811 
5812  p.x = FILL_X(col);
5813  p.y = FILL_Y(row);
5814  MapWindowPoints(s_textArea, s_hwnd, &p, 1);
5815  global_ime_set_position(&p);
5816 }
5817 
5818 /*
5819  * Set IM status on ("active" is TRUE) or off ("active" is FALSE).
5820  */
5821  void
5822 im_set_active(int active)
5823 {
5824  global_ime_set_status(active);
5825 }
5826 
5827 /*
5828  * Get IM status. When IM is on, return not 0. Else return 0.
5829  */
5830  int
5831 im_get_status(void)
5832 {
5833  return global_ime_get_status();
5834 }
5835 #endif
5836 
5837 /*
5838  * Convert latin9 text "text[len]" to ucs-2 in "unicodebuf".
5839  */
5840  static void
5841 latin9_to_ucs(char_u *text, int len, WCHAR *unicodebuf)
5842 {
5843  int c;
5844 
5845  while (--len >= 0)
5846  {
5847  c = *text++;
5848  switch (c)
5849  {
5850  case 0xa4: c = 0x20ac; break; /* euro */
5851  case 0xa6: c = 0x0160; break; /* S hat */
5852  case 0xa8: c = 0x0161; break; /* S -hat */
5853  case 0xb4: c = 0x017d; break; /* Z hat */
5854  case 0xb8: c = 0x017e; break; /* Z -hat */
5855  case 0xbc: c = 0x0152; break; /* OE */
5856  case 0xbd: c = 0x0153; break; /* oe */
5857  case 0xbe: c = 0x0178; break; /* Y */
5858  }
5859  *unicodebuf++ = c;
5860  }
5861 }
5862 
5863 #ifdef FEAT_RIGHTLEFT
5864 /*
5865  * What is this for? In the case where you are using Win98 or Win2K or later,
5866  * and you are using a Hebrew font (or Arabic!), Windows does you a favor and
5867  * reverses the string sent to the TextOut... family. This sucks, because we
5868  * go to a lot of effort to do the right thing, and there doesn't seem to be a
5869  * way to tell Windblows not to do this!
5870  *
5871  * The short of it is that this 'RevOut' only gets called if you are running
5872  * one of the new, "improved" MS OSes, and only if you are running in
5873  * 'rightleft' mode. It makes display take *slightly* longer, but not
5874  * noticeably so.
5875  */
5876  static void
5877 RevOut( HDC s_hdc,
5878  int col,
5879  int row,
5880  UINT foptions,
5881  CONST RECT *pcliprect,
5882  LPCTSTR text,
5883  UINT len,
5884  CONST INT *padding)
5885 {
5886  int ix;
5887 
5888  for (ix = 0; ix < (int)len; ++ix)
5889  ExtTextOut(s_hdc, col + TEXT_X(ix), row, foptions,
5890  pcliprect, text + ix, 1, padding);
5891 }
5892 #endif
5893 
5894  static void
5895 draw_line(
5896  int x1,
5897  int y1,
5898  int x2,
5899  int y2,
5900  COLORREF color)
5901 {
5902 #if defined(FEAT_DIRECTX)
5903  if (IS_ENABLE_DIRECTX())
5904  DWriteContext_DrawLine(s_dwc, x1, y1, x2, y2, color);
5905  else
5906 #endif
5907  {
